original: ngas tshor ba brgya rtsa brgyad du bshad pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod /
analyzed: ngas tshor ba brgya rtsa brgyad du bshad pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod /
translated: There are cases where I have explained feelings as one hundred and eight.

original: ngas tshor ba tshad med par bshad pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod do //
analyzed: ngas tshor ba tshad med par bshad pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod do //
translated: There are cases where I have explained feelings as immeasurable.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba gcig tu bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba gcig tu bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the category of feeling that I have explained as being one?

original: gang cung zad tshor ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: gang cung zad tshor ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: All that is felt, whatever it may be, is suffering.

original: 'char byed rnam grangs 'dis na ngas tshor ba gcig tu bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed rnam grangs 'dis na ngas tshor ba gcig tu bshad do //
translated: By this category, I have explained feeling as being one.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba gnyis su bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba gnyis su bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the category of feeling that I have explained as being two?

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi ste /
translated: The feeling of the body and the feeling of the mind.

original: 'char byed rnam grangs 'dis na ngas tshor ba gnyis su bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed rnam grangs 'dis na ngas tshor ba gnyis su bshad do //
translated: By this category, I have explained feeling as being two.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba gsum du bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba gsum du bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the category of feeling that I have explained as being three?

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba ste /
translated: Pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba gsum du bshad do //
translated: By this category, I have explained feeling as being three.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba bzhir bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba bzhir bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the category of feeling that I have explained as being four?

original: 'dod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / gzugs dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / zag pa med pa dang yang dag par ldan ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / gzugs dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / zag pa med pa dang yang dag par ldan ba ste /
translated: associated with the desire realm, associated with the form realm, associated with the formless realm, and uncontaminated.

original: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba bzhir bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba bzhir bshad do //
translated: Udayin, I have explained feeling in these four ways.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba lngar bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba lngar bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: “Udayin, what are the categories I have explained as the five kinds of feeling?

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal ba'i dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal ba'i dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po ste /
translated: The faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of mental displeasure, and the faculty of equanimity.

original: 'char byed ngas @5b rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba lngar bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed ngas @5b rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba lngar bshad do //
translated: Udayin, I have explained feeling in these five ways.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba drug tu bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba drug tu bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: “Udayin, what are the categories I have explained as the six kinds of feeling?

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba ste /
translated: The feeling that arises from the contact of the eye, the feeling that arises from the contact of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba drug tu bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba drug tu bshad do //
translated: Udayin, by this method I have explained the six feelings.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba bco brgyad du bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba bco brgyad du bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: “Udayin, what is the method by which I have explained the eighteen feelings?

original: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug ste /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba drug dang / btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug ste /
translated: The six feelings of satisfaction, the six feelings of dissatisfaction, and the six feelings of neither satisfaction nor dissatisfaction.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdams na tshor ba bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdams na tshor ba bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: When these are combined into one group, they become the eighteen feelings.

original: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba bco brgyad du bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba bco brgyad du bshad do //
translated: Udayin, by this method I have explained the eighteen feelings.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug tu bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug tu bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: “Udayin, what is the method by which I have explained the thirty-six feelings?

original: yid bde ba zhen pa la brten pa drug dang / yid bde ba mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa drug dang / yid mi bde bzhin pa la brten pa drug dang / yid mi bde ba mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa drug dang /
analyzed: yid bde ba zhen pa la brten pa drug dang / yid bde ba mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa drug dang / yid mi bde bzhin pa la brten pa drug dang / yid mi bde ba mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa drug dang /
translated: the six that are based on attachment to mental pleasure, the six that are based on the arising of mental pleasure, the six that are based on attachment to mental displeasure, the six that are based on the arising of mental displeasure,

original: btang snyoms zhen pa la brten pa drug dang / btang snyoms mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa drug ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms zhen pa la brten pa drug dang / btang snyoms mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa drug ste /
translated: the six that are based on attachment to equanimity, and the six that are based on the arising of equanimity.

original: gcig tu bsdus nas sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus nas sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro /
translated: When these are combined into one, there are thirty-six.

original: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug tu bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug tu bshad do //
translated: Udayin, I have explained the thirty-six types of feeling.

original: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs gang gis tshor ba brgya rtsa brgyad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs gang gis tshor ba brgya rtsa brgyad du bshad ce na /
translated: “Udayin, by what method have I explained the one hundred and eight types of feeling?

original: 'das pa'i dus su byung ba'i tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na byung ba'i tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su byung ba'i tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus na byung ba'i tshor ba sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: The thirty-six feelings that occurred in the past, the thirty-six feelings that will occur in the future, and the thirty-six feelings that occur in the present.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus na tshor ba brgya rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus na tshor ba brgya rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: When these are combined into one, they become the one hundred and eight feelings.

original: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba brgya rtsa brgyad du bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba brgya rtsa brgyad du bshad do //
translated: Udayin, by this method I have explained the one hundred and eight feelings.

original: 'char byed ngas tshor ba dpag tu med par bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'char byed ngas tshor ba dpag tu med par bshad pa'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: “Udayin, what is the method by which I have explained immeasurable feelings?

original: ji ltar tshor yang tshor ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: ji ltar tshor yang tshor ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: Whatever is felt is counted as a feeling.

original: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba dpag tu med par bshad do //
analyzed: 'char byed ngas rnam grangs 'dis na tshor ba dpag tu med par bshad do //
translated: Udayin, by this method I have explained immeasurable feelings.”

original: 'char byed gang 'ba' zhig ngas rnam grangs kyis bshad pa'i chos rnams rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du thams cad kyis don thams cad mi shes na /🔽de dag 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / rnam par smra ba dang / rtsod par skye zhing byung ba dag ston pa'i chos 'dul bas nye bar ma zhi @6a * //
analyzed: 'char byed gang 'ba' zhig ngas rnam grangs kyis bshad pa'i chos rnams rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du thams cad kyis don thams cad mi shes na / de dag 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / rnam par smra ba dang / rtsod par skye zhing byung ba dag ston pa'i chos 'dul bas nye bar ma zhi @6a * //
translated: If some people do not understand all the meanings of all the topics that I have explained in various ways,

original: bar gnas so zhes re bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar gnas so zhes re bar bya'o //
translated: they will live in the Teacher's Dharma-Vinaya without peace, having given rise to disputes, quarrels, contention, disputation, and arguments.

original: 'char byed gang 'ga' zhig ngas rnam grangs kyis bshad ba'i chos rnams rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du thams cad kyis don thams cad shes na /
analyzed: 'char byed gang 'ga' zhig ngas rnam grangs kyis bshad ba'i chos rnams rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du thams cad kyis don thams cad shes na /
translated: If some people understand all the meanings of all the topics that I have explained in various ways,

original: de dag 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / rnam par smra ba dang ; rtsod pa skyes shing byung ba dag ston pa'i chos 'dul ba la nye bar zhi zhing gnas par 'gyur ro zhes re bar bya'o zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: de dag 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / rnam par smra ba dang ; rtsod pa skyes shing byung ba dag ston pa'i chos 'dul ba la nye bar zhi zhing gnas par 'gyur ro zhes re bar bya'o zhes gsungs so /
translated: they will live in the Teacher's Dharma-Vinaya with peace, having given rise to disputes, quarrels, contention, disputation, and arguments.

original: // / ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid la dgongs nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid la dgongs nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: I have stated conditioned things are impermanent with a specific intention.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gcig bu dben pa na nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa na sems la sems kyis yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gcig bu dben pa na nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa na sems la sems kyis yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda, alone, secluded, dwelling in the wilderness, had this thought:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gsum du yang gsungs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gsum du yang gsungs la /
translated: The Blessed One has also taught three feelings: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes kyang gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes kyang gsungs /
translated: The Blessed One has also said, Whatever feeling there is, all of that is suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci la dgongs nas tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs snyam du sems na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci la dgongs nas tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs snyam du sems na /
translated: If I think, With what intention did the Blessed One say, 'Whatever feeling there is, all of that is suffering'?

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dgongs ka nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dgongs ka nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Then, in the evening, the venerable Ānanda rose from his seclusion🔽and approached the Blessed One.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas /
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas /
translated: Having approached and prostrated at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: he sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan ba kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan ba kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun ba bcom ldan 'das 'di na bdag gcig pu dben par gyur pa na nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa na sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
analyzed: btsun ba bcom ldan 'das 'di na bdag gcig pu dben par gyur pa na nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa na sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
translated: “Venerable Blessed One, while I was alone in seclusion, dwelling in meditative equipoise, these kinds of thoughts arose in my mind:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshor ba 'di gsum du yang gsungs la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshor ba 'di gsum du yang gsungs la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‘The Blessed One has also said that these three feelings are spoken of, up to

original: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes kyang gsungs zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes kyang gsungs zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: that whatever feelings there are, all of them are suffering.’

original: kun dga' bo ngas 'du byed ni mi rtag pa nyid dang yongs su 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun dga' bo ngas 'du byed ni mi rtag pa nyid dang yongs su 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Ānanda, I have said, “Whatever feelings there are, all are suffering,” intending the impermanence and change of conditioned things.

original: kun dga' bo 'on kyang 'du byed rnams rim pa bzhin du nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing rim pa @6b bzhin du 'du byed rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'on kyang 'du byed rnams rim pa bzhin du nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing rim pa @6b bzhin du 'du byed rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Ānanda, conditioned things gradually subside, conditioned things gradually cease,

original: rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor rab tu 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor rab tu 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: conditioned things gradually cease completely, conditioned things gradually cease well.

original: btsun ba ji lta ji ltar 'du byed rnams rim gyis nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: btsun ba ji lta ji ltar 'du byed rnams rim gyis nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: “Lord, how do conditioned things gradually subside, how do conditioned things gradually cease?”

original: kun dga' bo bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs na ngag nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs na ngag nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Ānanda, when one enters the first meditative absorption, speech subsides.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs na rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs na rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters the second concentration, investigation and analysis are pacified.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs na dga' ba nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs na dga' ba nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters the third concentration, joy is pacified.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters the fourth concentration, inhalation and exhalation are pacified.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs na 'du byed dang tshor ba nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /🔽kun dga' bo 'di ltar 'du byed rnams rim pa bzhin du nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs na 'du byed dang tshor ba nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te / kun dga' bo 'di ltar 'du byed rnams rim pa bzhin du nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters the absorption of the cessation of discriminations and feelings, formations and feelings are pacified.🔽Ānanda, in this way, formations are gradually pacified, and in this way, formations are gradually extinguished.

original: btsun pa 'di ltar 'du byed rnams rim gyis nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: btsun pa 'di ltar 'du byed rnams rim gyis nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur na /
translated: “Lord, in this way, formations are gradually pacified, and in this way, formations are gradually extinguished.

original: btsun pa ji lta ji ltar rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: btsun pa ji lta ji ltar rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Venerable, how do formations cease individually in sequence?

original: rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams rab tu so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams rab tu so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do formations cease individually in sequence?”

original: kun dga' bo bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs na ngag so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs na ngag so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Ānanda, when one enters the first concentration, speech ceases individually.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs na 'du shes dang tshor ba so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs na 'du shes dang tshor ba so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: When one enters the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling cease individually.

original: kun dga' bo 'di ltar na rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ltar na rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor 'gag par 'gyur zhing rim pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams so sor 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ānanda, in this way formations cease individually in sequence and formations cease individually in sequence.”

original: kun dga' bo so sor 'gag pa de dag las mchog tu gyur pa'i so sor 'gag pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bo so sor 'gag pa de dag las mchog tu gyur pa'i so sor 'gag pa /
translated: “Ānanda, from among those individual cessations, the individual cessation that is supreme,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i so sor 'gag pa /🔽bla na med pa'i so sor 'gag pa /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i so sor 'gag pa / bla na med pa'i so sor 'gag pa /
translated: the individual cessation that is exalted,🔽the individual cessation that is unsurpassed,

original: gong na med pa'i so sor 'gag pa /
analyzed: gong na med pa'i so sor 'gag pa /
translated: the individual cessation that is unequalled,

original: so sor 'gag pa gzhan las so sor 'gag pa /
analyzed: so sor 'gag pa gzhan las so sor 'gag pa /
translated: There is another cessation, a cessation from another cessation.

original: bla na med par 'jug pa /
analyzed: bla na med par 'jug pa /
translated: It is an engagement in the unsurpassed,

original: 'das par 'jug pa /🔽gya nom par 'jug pa drug pa yang yod de /🔽kun dga' bo so sor 'gag pa de dag las zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'das par 'jug pa / gya nom par 'jug pa drug pa yang yod de / kun dga' bo so sor 'gag pa de dag las zhes bya ba nas /
translated: an engagement in the transcendent,🔽an engagement in the sublime.

original: so sor 'gag pa gzhan las so sor 'gag pa /
analyzed: so sor 'gag pa gzhan las so sor 'gag pa /
translated: What is that cessation from another cessation,

original: bla na med par 'jug pa /🔽'das par 'jug pa /
analyzed: bla na med par 'jug pa / 'das par 'jug pa /
translated: an engagement in the unsurpassed,🔽an engagement in the transcendent,

original: gya nom par 'jug pa drug pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gya nom par 'jug pa drug pa de gang zhe na /
translated: an engagement in the sublime?

original: kun dga' bo 'di na dge slong sems @7a * //🔽'dod chags las 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di na dge slong sems @7a * // 'dod chags las 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol bar 'gyur /
translated: Ānanda, here a monk🔽is free from attachment to desire and his mind is liberated.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol bar gyur pa ste /
translated: He is free from attachment to anger and delusion and his mind is liberated.

original: kun dga' bo 'di ni so sor 'gag pa de dag las zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ni so sor 'gag pa de dag las zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Ānanda, this is the cessation from another cessation,

original: so sor 'gag pa gzhan las so sor 'gag pa ;
analyzed: so sor 'gag pa gzhan las so sor 'gag pa ;
translated: a cessation from another cessation,

original: bla na med par 'jug pa /
analyzed: bla na med par 'jug pa /
translated: an engagement in the unsurpassed,

original: 'das par 'jug pa /
analyzed: 'das par 'jug pa /
translated: an engagement in the transcendent,

original: gya nom par 'jug pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: gya nom par 'jug pa drug pa'o //
translated: an engagement in the sublime.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab mkhyen pas //🔽'du byed mi rtag nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab mkhyen pas // 'du byed mi rtag nyid dang ni //
translated: The perfect Buddha, the Omniscient One,🔽knowing the impermanence of conditioned things

original: yongs su 'gyur ba nyid mkhyen nas //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba nyid mkhyen nas //
translated: and their complete transformation,

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal zhes gsungs so //
translated: taught that feeling is suffering.

original: gang yang dge slong brtson ldan zhing //
analyzed: gang yang dge slong brtson ldan zhing //
translated: The monk who is diligent

original: shes bzhin yongs su mi gtong ba //
analyzed: shes bzhin yongs su mi gtong ba //
translated: and does not abandon vigilance,

original: de yis tshor ba 'di dag kun //
analyzed: de yis tshor ba 'di dag kun //
translated: knows all these feelings

original: yongs su shes pa de mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa de mkhas pa'o //
translated: and is wise.

original: de yis tshor ba yongs shes nas //
analyzed: de yis tshor ba yongs shes nas //
translated: Knowing these feelings,

original: mthong ba'i chos la zag pa med //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la zag pa med //
translated: he is free from defilements in this very life.

original: phung po zhig par gyur pa na //
analyzed: phung po zhig par gyur pa na //
translated: When the aggregates are destroyed,

original: shes rab mya ngan 'das grangs 'thob //
analyzed: shes rab mya ngan 'das grangs 'thob //
translated: he attains the state of nirvana through wisdom.

original: ces gsungs so /
analyzed: ces gsungs so /
translated: It is said:

original: // / bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal ba nyid du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal ba nyid du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Pleasant feeling should be seen as suffering.”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag ste /
translated: “Monks, there are three feelings.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: pleasant feeling, unpleasant feeling, and neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: dge slong dag de la bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de la bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Bhikṣus, you should view pleasant feeling as suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni zug rngur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni zug rngur blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should view unpleasant feeling as a thorn.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba ni mi rtag pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba ni mi rtag pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can du blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should view neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as impermanent, subject to destruction, and subject to change.

original: dge slong dag dge slong gang zhig bde ba'i tshor ba sdug bsngal du mthong bar gyur cing /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong gang zhig bde ba'i tshor ba sdug bsngal du mthong bar gyur cing /
translated: Bhikṣus, if a bhikṣu sees pleasant feeling as suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'bras dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni mi rtag pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can du mthong na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'bras dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni mi rtag pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can du mthong na /
translated: sees unpleasant feeling as a thorn, and sees neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as impermanent, subject to destruction, and subject to change,

original: dge slong 'dis yang dag pa legs par mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'dis yang dag pa legs par mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: that bhikṣu is said to have seen correctly.

original: ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad bka' stsal to //
translated: The Teacher also said this:

original: gang gis bde ba sdug bsngal mthong //
analyzed: gang gis bde ba sdug bsngal mthong //
translated: “He who sees pleasure as suffering,🔽and likewise suffering as a dart,

original: de bzhin sdug bsngal zug rngu dang // bde min sdug bsngal ma yin la //🔽mi rtag nyid du mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: de bzhin sdug bsngal zug rngu dang // bde min sdug bsngal ma yin la // mi rtag nyid du mthong gyur pa //
translated: and neither-pleasure-nor-suffering as impermanent,

original: dge slong de yis yang dag mthong //
analyzed: dge slong de yis yang dag mthong //
translated: that monk sees correctly.🔽He touches the state of peace,

original: zhi zhing zhi ba'i go 'phang reg / bdag tu 'dzin pa bcom nas ni //
analyzed: zhi zhing zhi ba'i go 'phang reg / bdag tu 'dzin pa bcom nas ni //
translated: having destroyed the conception of self,

original: bdud kyi sde las rgyal bar 'gyur //🔽@7b zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: bdud kyi sde las rgyal bar 'gyur // @7b zhes gsungs so /
translated: he conquers the army of Mara.”

original: // / gang yang ji skad du sdug bsngal ba la bde'o zhes 'du shes phyin ci log ces bya ba la /
analyzed: // / gang yang ji skad du sdug bsngal ba la bde'o zhes 'du shes phyin ci log ces bya ba la /
translated: “In regard to what is said: ‘In regard to suffering, the ideation is erroneous, the choice is erroneous, the consciousness is erroneous,’

original: mu bzhi pa'i tshoms kyi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i mdo gnyis pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa'i tshoms kyi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa'i mdo gnyis pa las 'byung ba /
translated: the four alternatives should be understood according to the second discourse of the four alternatives in the Catuskoṭigatha Sutra.

original: mdzod kyi gnas lnga pa 'di nyid du phyin ci log gi mdo las bris pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdzod kyi gnas lnga pa 'di nyid du phyin ci log gi mdo las bris pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as it is written in the Sutra on the Errors in the chapter on the five aggregates in the Abhidharma-samuccaya.

original: gang yang bde ba'i dbang po dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang bde ba'i dbang po dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: “In regard to what is said: ‘The faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of mental displeasure, the faculty of equanimity,’

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: the setting is in Shravasti.

original: dge slong dag dbang po ni lnga po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag dbang po ni lnga po 'di dag ste /
translated: “Monks, there are five faculties:

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang bo dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang bo dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of mental displeasure, and the faculty of equanimity.

original: de la bde ba'i dbang po gang yin ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa ni bde ba'i tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba'i dbang po gang yin ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa ni bde ba'i tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Among them, the faculty of pleasure and the faculty of mental pleasure should be regarded as the feeling of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po gang yin ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po gang yin ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The faculty of pain and the faculty of mental displeasure should be regarded as the feeling of pain.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang yin pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang yin pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The faculty of equanimity should be regarded as neither pleasure nor pain.

original: gang gis dbang po lnga po 'di dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong na kun du sbyor ba gsum spong zhing yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis dbang po lnga po 'di dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong na kun du sbyor ba gsum spong zhing yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Whoever sees these five faculties with correct wisdom as they are in reality abandons and fully understands the three fetters.

original: gsum gang zhe na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: What are the three? They are the afflicted view of the self, holding ethics and spiritual disciplines as paramount, and doubt.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa mi ltung ba'i chos can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges pa mchog tu thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa mi ltung ba'i chos can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges pa mchog tu thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa /
translated: They are stream enterers who do not fall into lower rebirths, are certain to attain perfect enlightenment, and are at most impeded seven times,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun du nying mtshams sbyar nas sdug bsngal mthar byed par gyur pa dag yin no zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun du nying mtshams sbyar nas sdug bsngal mthar byed par gyur pa dag yin no zhes gsungs so /
translated: who will end suffering after connecting to seven existences among gods and humans.

original: // / ming chen gzugs gcig tu sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / ming chen gzugs gcig tu sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Mahanama, form is suffering in the sense of being a single unit and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can na spre'u'i rdzing gi gtsug lag khang na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can na spre'u'i rdzing gi gtsug lag khang na bzhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavan was dwelling in Vaisali in the monastery of the Monkey’s Pond.

original: de'i tshe na litstsha b'i ming chen zhes bya ba nyi ma re re zhing bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir brtson bar byed par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na litstsha b'i ming chen zhes bya ba nyi ma re re zhing bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir brtson bar byed par gyur to //
translated: At that time, there was a Licchavi named Mahānāman who was diligent in going to see the Blessed One and serving him every day.

original: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'di snyam du bdag bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir 'gro na /
analyzed: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'di snyam du bdag bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir 'gro na /
translated: Then this thought occurred to Mahānāman the Licchavi: “If I go to see the Blessed One and serve him,

original: re zhig nam nangs kyi bar du bcom ldan 'das kyang nang du yang dag 'jog las ma bzhengs shing /🔽dge slong rnams kyang nang du yang dag 'jog las ma langs pas bdag 'tsho ba pa'i aa mra bdun pa dag @8a * //
analyzed: re zhig nam nangs kyi bar du bcom ldan 'das kyang nang du yang dag 'jog las ma bzhengs shing / dge slong rnams kyang nang du yang dag 'jog las ma langs pas bdag 'tsho ba pa'i aa mra bdun pa dag @8a * //
translated: the Blessed One will not rise from his meditative composure until dawn,

original: gi nang du nye bar 'gro bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: gi nang du nye bar 'gro bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: and the monks will not rise from their meditative composure. Therefore, I will go to the grove of the seven mango trees of the Jyotiṣka family.”

original: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'tsho ba pa'i aa mra bdun pa'i kun dga' rab gang na ba der song ngo //
analyzed: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'tsho ba pa'i aa mra bdun pa'i kun dga' rab gang na ba der song ngo //
translated: Then Mahānāman the Licchavi went to the grove of the seven mango trees of the Jyotiṣka family.

original: de'i tsho na 'tsho ba pa'i aa mra bdun pa'i kun dga' ra ba na 'od srungs rdzogs byed dge 'dun gyi grangs kyis bgrang zhing 'phags pa ltar bcos pa'i skye bo mang po dang chen por bgrang pa dag gis mdun du byas te /
analyzed: de'i tsho na 'tsho ba pa'i aa mra bdun pa'i kun dga' ra ba na 'od srungs rdzogs byed dge 'dun gyi grangs kyis bgrang zhing 'phags pa ltar bcos pa'i skye bo mang po dang chen por bgrang pa dag gis mdun du byas te /
translated: At that time, in the pleasure grove of the seven mango trees of the Ājīvikas, Pūraṇa Kāśyapa, who was counted among the saṅgha and was a great being who pretended to be an ārya, was staying there with a large retinue.

original: 'tsho ba pa lnga brgya tsam gyis gtso bor byas te 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: 'tsho ba pa lnga brgya tsam gyis gtso bor byas te 'dug par gyur te /
translated: He was the leader of about five hundred Ājīvikas.

original: de'i 'khor rnams ku co dang ca co dang sgra gsang chen po dang / sgra gsang mthon po dag gis so so nas smra ste /
analyzed: de'i 'khor rnams ku co dang ca co dang sgra gsang chen po dang / sgra gsang mthon po dag gis so so nas smra ste /
translated: His retinue was making a great clamor, with each one speaking loudly and noisily.

original: dud 'gro'i gtam brjod cing 'dus par gyur cing 'dug pas 'ong srungs rdzogs byed kyis litstsha b'i ming chen 'ongs par gyur pa dag thag ring po nas sngar mthong nas rang gi 'khor rnams la sgra chung dur byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i gtam brjod cing 'dus par gyur cing 'dug pas 'ong srungs rdzogs byed kyis litstsha b'i ming chen 'ongs par gyur pa dag thag ring po nas sngar mthong nas rang gi 'khor rnams la sgra chung dur byed du bcug ste /
translated: They were sitting there, gathered together, talking about animals. When Pūraṇa Kāśyapa saw that Mahānāman of the Licchavi clan had arrived, he first saw him from a distance and told his retinue to be quiet.

original: khyed cag re zhig sgra chung ngur gyis shig / khyed cag kha rog 'dug cig / dge sbyong goo ta ma'i nyan thos litstsha b'i ming chen zhes bya ba 'ong zhing 'dug gi / dge sbyong goo ta ma'i nyan thos yangs pa can na gnas pa khyim pa
analyzed: khyed cag re zhig sgra chung ngur gyis shig / khyed cag kha rog 'dug cig / dge sbyong goo ta ma'i nyan thos litstsha b'i ming chen zhes bya ba 'ong zhing 'dug gi / dge sbyong goo ta ma'i nyan thos yangs pa can na gnas pa khyim pa
translated: Among the ascetic Gautama’s disciples who live in Vaiśālī,

original: gos dkar po gyon pa de dag las litstsha b'i ming chen ni mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gos dkar po gyon pa de dag las litstsha b'i ming chen ni mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: the Licchavi Mahānama is the best,

original: sgra chung bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: sgra chung bar 'dod pa /
translated: he is considered to be quiet,

original: sgra chung ba la dga' pa /🔽sgra chung bas 'dul ba /
analyzed: sgra chung ba la dga' pa / sgra chung bas 'dul ba /
translated: he delights in quietude,🔽he is disciplined by quietude,

original: sgra chung ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa /
analyzed: sgra chung ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa /
translated: he praises quietude,

original: 'khor sgra chung bar rig nas 'ong bar bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'khor sgra chung bar rig nas 'ong bar bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: and knowing that his retinue is quiet, he will come.”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / 'khor rnams kha rog 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / 'khor rnams kha rog 'dug par gyur to //
translated: When this was said, the retinue became silent.

original: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'od srungs rdzogs byed gang na ba der nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'od srungs rdzogs byed gang na ba der nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: Then the Licchavi Mahānama went to Pūraṇa Kāśyapa and

original: nye bar 'ongs nas 'od srungs rdzogs byed dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' ba dang / yang dag par bde par 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te /🔽phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar 'ongs nas 'od srungs rdzogs byed dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' ba dang / yang dag par bde par 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te / phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, he sat down to one side and had a variety of pleasing and delightful conversations with Pūraṇa-kāśyapa.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas litstsha b'i ming chen gyis 'od srungs rdzogs byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas litstsha b'i ming chen gyis 'od srungs rdzogs byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, having sat down to one side, Licchavi Mahādeva said this to Pūraṇa-kāśyapa:

original: 'od srungs khyed 'od srung ba dag 'di skad du sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu med rkyen med /
analyzed: 'od srungs khyed 'od srung ba dag 'di skad du sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu med rkyen med /
translated: “Kāśyapa, I have heard that you teach the śrāvakas that the afflictions of sentient beings are without cause and without condition.

original: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med pa'i kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med pa'i kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: Sentient beings are afflicted without cause and without condition.

original: sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
translated: The purification of sentient beings is without cause and without condition.

original: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par rnam par byang ngo zhes nyan thos rnams la chos ston to zhes thos nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par rnam par byang ngo zhes nyan thos rnams la chos ston to zhes thos nas /
translated: Sentient beings are purified without cause and without condition.”

original: 'od srungs gang kha cig 'di skad smra zhing 'di skad du lung ston na khyed cag 'od srung ba dag smod par byed @8b dam ;
analyzed: 'od srungs gang kha cig 'di skad smra zhing 'di skad du lung ston na khyed cag 'od srung ba dag smod par byed @8b dam ;
translated: Kāśyapa, if someone were to say this and give a prediction like this, you Kāśyapas would criticize it.

original: mi bden par smra ba dang / khyed cag 'od srung ba'i chos smra ba dang / chos la chos kyi rjes su mthun par lung ston pa yin no //
analyzed: mi bden par smra ba dang / khyed cag 'od srung ba'i chos smra ba dang / chos la chos kyi rjes su mthun par lung ston pa yin no //
translated: You Kāśyapas would say that it is not true, that it is a Dharma teacher of the Kāśyapas, and that it is a prediction that accords with the Dharma.

original: 'ga' zhig 'ongs te 'khor gyi nang du chos smra ba dang rjes su smra na chos smad pa'i gnas su mi byed dam /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'ongs te 'khor gyi nang du chos smra ba dang rjes su smra na chos smad pa'i gnas su mi byed dam /
translated: If someone were to come and speak the Dharma in the assembly, would you not make a place for the criticism of the Dharma?

original: ming chen de skad du smra ste /
analyzed: ming chen de skad du smra ste /
translated: Mahānāma, that is what is said,

original: de ltar lung ston pa bden te /
analyzed: de ltar lung ston pa bden te /
translated: and that prediction is true.

original: smod par mi byed la /
analyzed: smod par mi byed la /
translated: You do not criticize it,

original: mi bden par smra ba ma yin la chos smra ba yin zhing /
analyzed: mi bden par smra ba ma yin la chos smra ba yin zhing /
translated: and it is not untrue. It is a Dharma teacher,

original: chos la chos kyi rjes su mthun par lung ston pa yin zhing de dag las 'ga' zhig 'ongs te 'khor gyi nang du chos smra ba dang rjes su smra na chos de lta bu smad pa'i gnas su mi byed do //
analyzed: chos la chos kyi rjes su mthun par lung ston pa yin zhing de dag las 'ga' zhig 'ongs te 'khor gyi nang du chos smra ba dang rjes su smra na chos de lta bu smad pa'i gnas su mi byed do //
translated: and it is a prediction that accords with the Dharma. If someone were to come and speak the Dharma in the assembly, you would not make a place for the criticism of such a Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming chen nga yang 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: ming chen nga yang 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: Mahānāman, I also see in this way and speak in this way.

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
translated: The afflictions of sentient beings have no cause and no condition.

original: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: Sentient beings are afflicted without cause and without condition.

original: sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
translated: The purification of sentient beings has no cause and no condition.

original: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par rnam par byang ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par rnam par byang ngo //
translated: Sentient beings are purified without cause and without condition.”

original: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'od srungs rdzogs byed kyis bshad pa la khro bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'od srungs rdzogs byed kyis bshad pa la khro bar yang mi byed /
translated: Then the Licchavi Mahānāman, not angry at Pūraṇa Kāśyapa’s explanation,

original: rjes su yi rang bar yang mi byed par stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar yang mi byed par stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: but not rejoicing in it either, rose from his seat and left.

original: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Then the Licchavi Mahānāman went to where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go ;
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go ;
translated: Having approached the Blessed One, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: / phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'od srungs rdzogs byed dang lhan cig gtam gzhan brjod pa de thams cad rgyas par bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: / phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas litstsha b'i ming chen 'od srungs rdzogs byed dang lhan cig gtam gzhan brjod pa de thams cad rgyas par bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, he related to the Blessed One in detail all the other conversations he had had with Mahānāman of the Licchavi clan and Pūraṇa Kāśyapa.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis litstsha b'i ming chen la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis litstsha b'i ming chen la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had finished speaking, the Blessed One said to Mahānāman of the Licchavi clan:

original: ming chen 'od srungs rdzogs byed ni ma dpyad par de'i rang bzhin ma yin ba dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i chos smra ba yin te /
analyzed: ming chen 'od srungs rdzogs byed ni ma dpyad par de'i rang bzhin ma yin ba dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i chos smra ba yin te /
translated: “Mahānāman, Pūraṇa Kāśyapa is not a proponent of non-analysis and non-investigation.

original: ji ltar yang byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas pa 'di skad du sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
analyzed: ji ltar yang byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas pa 'di skad du sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
translated: This foolish, confused, unclear, and unskilled person says, ‘The afflictions of sentient beings have no cause and no condition.

original: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: Sentient beings are afflicted without cause and without condition.

original: sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu med rkyen med de /
translated: The purification of sentient beings has no cause and no condition.

original: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par rnam par byang ngo zhes smra ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rgyu med rkyen med par rnam par byang ngo zhes smra ste /
translated: They say that sentient beings are purified without cause and without condition.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming chen sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas te /🔽sems can rnams ni rgyu dang @9a * //
analyzed: ming chen sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas te / sems can rnams ni rgyu dang @9a * //
translated: Mahanama, the afflictions of sentient beings are with cause and with condition.

original: bcas shing rkyen dang bcas par kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: bcas shing rkyen dang bcas par kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: Sentient beings are afflicted with cause and with condition.

original: sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The purification of sentient beings is with cause and with condition.

original: sems can rnams ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas par rnam par byang ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas par rnam par byang ngo //
translated: Sentient beings are purified with cause and with condition.

original: ming chen sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: ming chen sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Mahanama, the afflictions of sentient beings are with cause and with condition.

original: sems can rnams rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas par nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnams rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas par nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the afflictions of sentient beings with cause and with condition?

original: ming chen gzugs gcig tu sdug bsngal bar gyur na /
analyzed: ming chen gzugs gcig tu sdug bsngal bar gyur na /
translated: Mahanama, if form were exclusively suffering,

original: sems can rnams gzugs la chags par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems can rnams gzugs la chags par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Sentient beings would not be attached to form,

original: bde bar yang mi 'gyur ;
analyzed: bde bar yang mi 'gyur ;
translated: they would not be happy,

original: bde ba'i rjes su 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba'i rjes su 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: they would not pursue happiness,

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba chung ngu las 'das te /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba chung ngu las 'das te /
translated: they would transcend small happiness and mental pleasure,

original: bde ba'i rgyu nyid du yang shes par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu nyid du yang shes par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and they would not know form to be the cause of happiness.

original: ming chen gang gi phyir gzugs gcig tu sdug bsngal ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ming chen gang gi phyir gzugs gcig tu sdug bsngal ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Mahanama, because form is not exclusively suffering,

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba chung ngu las 'das te bde bar shes pa de'i phyir zhes can rnams gzugs la yang dag par chags shing chags nas yang dag par sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba chung ngu las 'das te bde bar shes pa de'i phyir zhes can rnams gzugs la yang dag par chags shing chags nas yang dag par sbyor ba dang /
translated: it is related to happiness and mental pleasure and transcends small happiness and mental pleasure and is known to be happiness, therefore sentient beings are truly attached to form and, being attached, they truly engage in it.

original: yang dag par sbyor bas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor bas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because they engage in it, they become afflicted.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / ming chen rnam par shes pa gcig tu sdug bsngal ba zhig tu gyur na sems can rnams rnam par shes pa la chags par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / ming chen rnam par shes pa gcig tu sdug bsngal ba zhig tu gyur na sems can rnams rnam par shes pa la chags par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Mahanama, if feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness were exclusively suffering, then sentient beings would not be attached to consciousness.

original: bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: It would not be pleasant.

original: bde ba'i rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba'i rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur /
translated: It would not be followed by pleasure.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba chung du las 'das te /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba chung du las 'das te /
translated: It would not transcend lesser pleasure and mental pleasure.

original: bde ba'i rgyu nyid du shes par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na ;
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu nyid du shes par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na ;
translated: It would not be recognized as the cause of pleasure.

original: ming chen gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa gcig tu sdug bsngal ma yin zhing bde ba dang yid bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba chung du las 'das te /
analyzed: ming chen gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa gcig tu sdug bsngal ma yin zhing bde ba dang yid bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba chung du las 'das te /
translated: Mahanama, because consciousness is not exclusively suffering, but is related to pleasure and mental pleasure, and transcends lesser pleasure and mental pleasure,

original: bde bar shes pa de'i phyir sems can rnams rnam par shes pa la yang dag par chags shing yang dag par chags pas yang dag par sbyor ba dang / yang dag par sbyor bas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde bar shes pa de'i phyir sems can rnams rnam par shes pa la yang dag par chags shing yang dag par chags pas yang dag par sbyor ba dang / yang dag par sbyor bas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the perception of pleasure, sentient beings are attached to consciousness. Because of attachment, they engage in activity. Because of engagement, they become afflicted.

original: ming chen rgyu 'di dang rkyen 'dis sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs shing /
analyzed: ming chen rgyu 'di dang rkyen 'dis sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs shing /
translated: Mahanama, because of these causes and conditions, sentient beings become afflicted.

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di dag gi rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di dag gi rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas so //
translated: The afflictions of sentient beings have causes and conditions.

original: ming chen sems can @9b rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: ming chen sems can @9b rnams kyi rnam par byang ba ni rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Mahanama, the purification of sentient beings has causes and conditions.

original: sems can rnams ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas par rnam par byang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas par rnam par byang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What are the causes and conditions for the purification of sentient beings?

original: ming chen gzugs gcig tu bde ba zhig tu gyur na sems can rnams gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal bar yang mi 'gyur sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ming chen gzugs gcig tu bde ba zhig tu gyur na sems can rnams gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal bar yang mi 'gyur sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: Mahanama, if form were exclusively pleasant, then sentient beings would not become free from attachment to form, nor would they suffer, nor would they follow after suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba chung ngu las 'das te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du yang shes par mi 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba chung ngu las 'das te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du yang shes par mi 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: They would not understand that form is the cause of suffering, and they would not transcend minor suffering and mental unhappiness.

original: ming chen gang gi phyir gzugs gcig tu bde ba ma yin zhing sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel ba dang / sdug bsngal yid mi bde ba chung du las 'das nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu shes pa de'i phyir sems can rnams gzugs la yang dag par chags pa dang bral zhing 'dod chags dang bral nas rnam par grol ba dang /
analyzed: ming chen gang gi phyir gzugs gcig tu bde ba ma yin zhing sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal dang rjes su 'brel ba dang / sdug bsngal yid mi bde ba chung du las 'das nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu shes pa de'i phyir sems can rnams gzugs la yang dag par chags pa dang bral zhing 'dod chags dang bral nas rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: Mahanama, because form is not exclusively pleasant, but is suffering and connected with suffering, and because it is the cause of suffering, sentient beings become free from attachment to form, and having become free from attachment, they are liberated.

original: rnam par grol nas yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol nas yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And having become liberated, they become completely purified.

original: tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / ming chen rnam par shes pa gcig tu bde ba zhig tu gyur na sems can rnams rnam par shes pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: tshor ba dang ; 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / ming chen rnam par shes pa gcig tu bde ba zhig tu gyur na sems can rnams rnam par shes pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: If feeling, perception, formation, and Maṇḍavyūha, consciousness were exclusively pleasant, then sentient beings would not become free from attachment to consciousness, nor would they experience suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i rjes su 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i rjes su 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: They would not pursue suffering,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang ; yid mi bde ba chung ngu las 'das nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du yang shes par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang ; yid mi bde ba chung ngu las 'das nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du yang shes par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and having transcended minor suffering and mental unhappiness, they would not even recognize the causes of suffering.

original: ming chen gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa gcig tu bde ba ma yin zhing sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'brel pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chung ngu las 'das te sdug bsngal bar shes pa de'i phyir sems can rnams rnam par shes pa las 'dod chags dang bral zhing 'dod chags dang bral nas rnam par grol ba dang /
analyzed: ming chen gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa gcig tu bde ba ma yin zhing sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'brel pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chung ngu las 'das te sdug bsngal bar shes pa de'i phyir sems can rnams rnam par shes pa las 'dod chags dang bral zhing 'dod chags dang bral nas rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: and is connected with pain, and is small, and is suffering, and is associated with mental dissatisfaction, therefore sentient beings are free from attachment to consciousness, and having been freed from attachment, they are liberated,

original: rnam par grol nas yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par grol nas yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: and having been liberated, they are purified.

original: ming chen rgyu 'di dang rkyen 'dis sems can rnams rnam par byang zhing /
analyzed: ming chen rgyu 'di dang rkyen 'dis sems can rnams rnam par byang zhing /
translated: Mahanama, by this cause and this condition sentient beings are purified.

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu 'di dag gis rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu 'di dag gis rgyu dang bcas shing rkyen dang bcas so //
translated: By these causes and conditions sentient beings are afflicted.

original: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs su spyi bos /
analyzed: de nas litstsha b'i ming chen bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs su spyi bos /
translated: Then the Licchavi Mahanama, having rejoiced in and delighted in the words of the Blessed One, touched his head to the Blessed One's feet.

original: @10a * // phyag byas nas /
analyzed: @10a * // phyag byas nas /
translated: Having bowed down to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo zhes gsungs so /
translated: he left the presence of the Blessed One.

original: // / mdo las sred pa gsungs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / mdo las sred pa gsungs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sūtra says that craving is taught.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The nidāna is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: Monks, these four are the āryan truths.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The āryan truth of suffering, the āryan truth of the origin of suffering, the āryan truth of the cessation of suffering, and the āryan truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the āryan truth of suffering?

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de dag sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de dag sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: the suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of association with what is unpleasant, the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, and the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: In brief, the five aggregates of clinging are suffering.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /🔽dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i sred pa yang srid par kun 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i sred pa yang srid par kun 'byung ba ste /
translated: What is the noble ones’ truth of the arising of suffering?

original: de dang de la mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: de dang de la mngon par dga'o //
translated: It is craving which leads to rebirth and is accompanied by passionate delight, finding pleasure now here now there—🔽namely, craving for sensual pleasure, craving for existence, and craving for non-existence.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the noble ones’ truth of the cessation of suffering?

original: gang yang dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i sred pa yang srid par byung ba de dang de la mngon par dga' ba la ma lus par spangs pa /🔽so sor 'gags pa /
analyzed: gang yang dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i sred pa yang srid par byung ba de dang de la mngon par dga' ba la ma lus par spangs pa / so sor 'gags pa /
translated: The complete abandonment of that,

original: zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gags par nye bar zhi bar nub pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gags par nye bar zhi bar nub pa'o //
translated: its abandonment, its complete abandonment, its extinction, its cessation, its pacification, its disappearance, its non-connection, its connection with something else, is called the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de /
translated: It is the noble eightfold path,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: which is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes gsungs so /
