original: de rnyed pa'i chos gos kyis mi snyems shing chos gos rnyed pa dag la ma chags par longs spyod de chags pa dang zhen pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brgyal ba dang / zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen par mi 'gyur zhing nyes dmigs mthong zhing nges par 'byung ba lang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas nye bar longs spyod de /
analyzed: de rnyed pa'i chos gos kyis mi snyems shing chos gos rnyed pa dag la ma chags par longs spyod de chags pa dang zhen pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brgyal ba dang / zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen par mi 'gyur zhing nyes dmigs mthong zhing nges par 'byung ba lang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas nye bar longs spyod de /
translated: He does not become arrogant because of the robes he has obtained, and he uses the robes he has obtained without attachment. He does not become attached, fixated, intent, infatuated, or obsessed. Seeing the disadvantages, he uses them as he should, knowing how to be free.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong mkhas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong mkhas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, the monk becomes wise, mindful, and introspective.

original: 'di ni dge slong sngon gyi 'phags pa'i rigs la gnyis pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong sngon gyi 'phags pa'i rigs la gnyis pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the second noble type of person among the monks.

original: chos gos ji lta ba bzhin du bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang stan yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos gos ji lta ba bzhin du bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang stan yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with the robes, so it is with alms-food, a bed and seat, and medicine.

original: gzhan yang dge slong spong ba la dga' bar 'gyur zhing spong ba la dga' ba dang / spong ba la dga' ba'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa dang / sgom pa la dga' bar gyur cing sgom pa la dga' ba dang / sgom pa la dga' ba'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong spong ba la dga' bar 'gyur zhing spong ba la dga' ba dang / spong ba la dga' ba'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa dang / sgom pa la dga' bar gyur cing sgom pa la dga' ba dang / sgom pa la dga' ba'i rjes su mthun par gyur pa ste /
translated: he delights in meditation, delights in meditation, and is in accord with delight in meditation.

original: de spong ba dang sgom pa la dga' bas bsnyems par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de spong ba dang sgom pa la dga' bas bsnyems par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because he delights in renunciation and meditation, he is not arrogant.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: For what reason is a monk endowed with mindfulness and introspection?

original: 'di dge slong sngon gyi 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dge slong sngon gyi 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called a monk who abides in the lineage of the former noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po 'di dag dang yang dag par ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos shar phyogs su nye bar brten cing gnas pa na mi dga' ba mi gnod de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po 'di dag dang yang dag par ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos shar phyogs su nye bar brten cing gnas pa na mi dga' ba mi gnod de /
translated: When a noble disciple endowed with these four noble lineages relies on and abides in the eastern direction, he is not harmed by displeasure.

original: de nyid kyis mi dga' ba la gnod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mi dga' ba la gnod do //
translated: By that very [fact], he is not harmed by displeasure.

original: de gal te lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su brten cing nye bar gnas pa na yang mi dga' bas mi gnod de /
analyzed: de gal te lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su brten cing nye bar gnas pa na yang mi dga' bas mi gnod de /
translated: If it is located in the south, west, or north, it is not harmful because it is not unpleasant.

original: des mi dga' ba la gnod par byed do //
analyzed: des mi dga' ba la gnod par byed do //
translated: It is harmful because it is unpleasant.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag gnang ba bzod @12b kyi ;
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa dag gnang ba bzod @12b kyi ;
translated: Monks, the noble disciples who are learned endure what is permitted.

original: mi dga' ba ni bzod do //🔽brtan rnams mi dga' mi bzod do //
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni bzod do // brtan rnams mi dga' mi bzod do //
translated: They endure what is unpleasant.🔽The steadfast endure what is pleasant.

original: brtan rnams dga' ba bzod pa yin //
analyzed: brtan rnams dga' ba bzod pa yin //
translated: The steadfast endure what is unpleasant.🔽By what can one turn away

original: de yis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kun //
analyzed: de yis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kun //
translated: from the abandonment of all sensual desire?

original: spong ba gang gis bzlog par nus //
analyzed: spong ba gang gis bzlog par nus //
translated: By what can one disparage

original: 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser 'od ltar //🔽de la gang gis smad par nus //🔽zhes gsungs so; ;
analyzed: 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser 'od ltar // de la gang gis smad par nus // zhes gsungs so; ;
translated: the radiance of gold from the Jambū River?

original: // sred pa skye ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // sred pa skye ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Craving arises in four ways.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag chos gos kyi rgyus sred pa skye bzhin pa na skye'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag chos gos kyi rgyus sred pa skye bzhin pa na skye'o //
translated: Monks, craving arises when there is a cause for robes. It arises when it is present.

original: gnas pa na gnas so //
analyzed: gnas pa na gnas so //
translated: It abides when it is present.

original: mngon par zhen pa na mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa na mngon par zhen to //
translated: When one is attached, one is attached.

original: bsod snyoms kyi rgyu dang / mal cha dang stan gyi rgyu dang ; srid pa mi 'byung ba'i rgyus sred pa skye bzhin pa na skye bo zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du 'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi rgyu dang / mal cha dang stan gyi rgyu dang ; srid pa mi 'byung ba'i rgyus sred pa skye bzhin pa na skye bo zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du 'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Craving arises due to the cause of alms, the cause of bedding and seats, and the cause of the non-arising of existence. When it arises, it is called people as before.

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: He said, When observing the body, mindfulness is well-established.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bzhi po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bzhi po 'di dag ste /
translated: Monks, there are these four establishments of mindfulness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na ;
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na ;
translated: What are the four?

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gnas so zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gnas so zhes gsungs so /
translated: Observing the body in the body, observing feelings, mind, and phenomena, mindfulness is well-established.

original: // / nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Observing the internal body, one abides.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa dag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa dag bstan par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I will teach the cultivation of the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen to it well and keep it in mind, I will speak.”

original: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the cultivation of the four establishments of mindfulness?

original: 'di la dge slong dag nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing brtun pa shes bzhin dang dran pa can 'jig rten kyi brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba bsal cing gnas so //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong dag nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing brtun pa shes bzhin dang dran pa can 'jig rten kyi brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba bsal cing gnas so //
translated: Here, monks, a monk, regarding his inner body, dwells observing closely, ardent, fully aware, and mindful, having subdued longing and dejection in regard to the world.

original: phyi'i lus dang phyi dang nang gi lus dang / nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / nang dang phyi'i sems dang / nang gi chos rnams dang /
analyzed: phyi'i lus dang phyi dang nang gi lus dang / nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / nang dang phyi'i sems dang / nang gi chos rnams dang /
translated: Regarding his outer body, regarding his inner and outer body, regarding his inner feelings, regarding his outer feelings, regarding his inner and outer feelings, regarding his inner mind, regarding his outer mind, regarding his inner and outer mind, regarding his inner dharmas,

original: phyi'i chos rnams dang / nang dang phyi'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pa 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba bsal te gnas so //🔽dge slong dag 'di ltar dran pa nye bar @13a * //
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams dang / nang dang phyi'i chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pa 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba bsal te gnas so // dge slong dag 'di ltar dran pa nye bar @13a * //
translated: He dwells contemplating phenomena as phenomena in regard to external phenomena, both internal and external phenomena, ardent, introspectively aware, mindful, having removed desire and aversion for the world.

original: gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa goms par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa goms par bya'o //
translated: “Monks, you should cultivate and make much of the four establishments of mindfulness.🔽Monks, you should cultivate and make much of the four establishments of mindfulness.”

original: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa goms par bya'o zhes bstan par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa goms par bya'o zhes bstan par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs so /
translated: I have explained in detail what I taught in brief.

original: // / de bzhin du tshe dang ldan par ma 'gags pas ji skad du zhes bya ba la tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa gnas bcas na tsher ma gsum pa can gyi tshal na brten cing gnas so //
analyzed: // / de bzhin du tshe dang ldan par ma 'gags pas ji skad du zhes bya ba la tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa gnas bcas na tsher ma gsum pa can gyi tshal na brten cing gnas so //
translated: Similarly, the Venerable Aniruddha said, “Here, the Venerable Aniruddha, having stayed in Kosambī for as long as he liked, rose from his seat, and after putting his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground,

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po brga na ri bong gsod pa zhes bya ba ri dvags kyi nags 'jigs pa'i sgra can gyi nags na rten cing nye bar gnas so ;
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po brga na ri bong gsod pa zhes bya ba ri dvags kyi nags 'jigs pa'i sgra can gyi nags na rten cing nye bar gnas so ;
translated: At that time, the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana was staying in the forest of the fearful deer, in the forest of Bhargaṇā, called Śiśumāra.

original: ; de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa gcig pu dben par gyur pa na nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa na sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
analyzed: ; de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa gcig pu dben par gyur pa na nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa na sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
translated: Then, when the venerable Aniruddha was alone in seclusion, dwelling in right contemplation, this kind of thought arose in his mind:

original: sems can rnams yongs su dag par byed cing mya ngan dang yongs su 'tsho ba las 'da' zhing sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba rnams nub nas rigs pa'i chos rtogs pa'i theg pa ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su dag par byed cing mya ngan dang yongs su 'tsho ba las 'da' zhing sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba rnams nub nas rigs pa'i chos rtogs pa'i theg pa ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: “Sentient beings are purified, and they transcend sorrow and the cycle of existence. Suffering and unhappiness subside, and the realization of the Dharma of reason is a single vehicle.

original: 'di lta ste dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'o //
translated: It is as follows: the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of the body, the establishment of mindfulness of feelings, the establishment of mindfulness of mind, and the establishment of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: gang 'ga' zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la mi dga' ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i tshul la mi dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la mi dga' ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i tshul la mi dga' ba yin la /
translated: I say that those who do not delight in the four establishments of mindfulness do not delight in the way of the noble ones.

original: gang 'phags pa'i tshul la mi dga' ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam la mi dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i tshul la mi dga' ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam la mi dga' ba yin la /
translated: Those who do not delight in the way of the noble ones do not delight in the noble path.

original: gang 'phags pa'i lam la mi dga' ba de dag ni thar pa la mi dga' la ;
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i lam la mi dga' ba de dag ni thar pa la mi dga' la ;
translated: Those who do not delight in the noble path do not delight in liberation.

original: gang thar pa la mi dga' ba de dag ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
analyzed: gang thar pa la mi dga' ba de dag ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
translated: Those who do not delight in liberation are not liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain,

original: 'khrugs pa las ma grol zhing sdug bsngal ba'o zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa las ma grol zhing sdug bsngal ba'o zhes nga smra'o //
translated: and distress, and I say they are miserable.

original: gang 'ga' zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la dga' ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i tshul la dga' la //
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la dga' ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i tshul la dga' la //
translated: I say that those who delight in the four establishments of mindfulness delight in the way of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i tshul la dga' ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam la dga' zhing /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshul la dga' ba de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam la dga' zhing /
translated: Those who delight in the way of the noble ones delight in the noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la dga' ba de dag ni thar pa la dga' la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la dga' ba de dag ni thar pa la dga' la /
translated: Those who delight in the noble path delight in liberation.

original: thar pa la @13b dga' ba de dag ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thar pa la @13b dga' ba de dag ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who delight in liberation are liberated.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa las rnam par grol zhing sdug bsngal med pa'o zhes nga smra'o//
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa las rnam par grol zhing sdug bsngal med pa'o zhes nga smra'o//
translated: I say that they are liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress, and are free from suffering.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa'i sems sems kyis rnam par shes nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa'i sems sems kyis rnam par shes nas /
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, knowing the thoughts that were in the mind of the venerable Aniruddha,

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: entered into such a samādhi

original: skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i lag pa brkyang ba las bskum pa 'am /
analyzed: skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i lag pa brkyang ba las bskum pa 'am /
translated: that like a strong man extending or contracting his arm,

original: bskum pa las brkyang ba tsam gyis tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po brga ri bong gsod pa zhes bya ba ni dags kyi nags 'jigs pa can nas mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: bskum pa las brkyang ba tsam gyis tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po brga ri bong gsod pa zhes bya ba ni dags kyi nags 'jigs pa can nas mi snang bar gyur te /
translated: Just as he was stretching out his legs after bending them, the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana disappeared from the terrifying Mṛgāra’s Wood

original: tsher ma gsum pa can gyi tshal du tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa'i mdun du 'dug nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tsher ma gsum pa can gyi tshal du tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa'i mdun du 'dug nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: and appeared in front of the venerable Aniruddha in the Triśaṅku Wood, and said this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa khyod gcig pu dben par gyur pa na nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa na sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu ma skyes sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa khyod gcig pu dben par gyur pa na nang du yang dag 'jog la gnas pa na sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa 'di lta bu ma skyes sam /
translated: “Venerable Aniruddha, when you are alone, secluded, and dwelling in meditation, has this kind of thought not arisen in your mind?

original: sems can rnams yongs su dag par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su dag par byed cing /
translated: ‘Sentient beings are purified,

original: mya ngang dang yongs su 'tshe ba thams cad las 'da' la sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rnams nub nas rigs pa'i chos rtogs pa'i theg pa ni gcig kho na ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mya ngang dang yongs su 'tshe ba thams cad las 'da' la sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rnams nub nas rigs pa'i chos rtogs pa'i theg pa ni gcig kho na ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and they transcend all suffering and harm. Suffering and unhappiness subside, and the vehicle that realizes the Dharma of reasoning is the only one. . . .’

original: rgyas par sdug bsngal pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rgyas par sdug bsngal pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: and so on up to: “There is no one who suffers.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po de bzhin no //
translated: Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, it is so!

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa ji tsam gyis na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la dga' bar 'gyur zhing rab tu dga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa ji tsam gyis na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la dga' bar 'gyur zhing rab tu dga' bar 'gyur /
translated: Venerable Aniruddha, to what extent do you delight in and rejoice in the cultivation of the four establishments of mindfulness?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po 'di la dge slong lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po 'di la dge slong lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: “Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, here a monk dwells contemplating the body as a body,

original: de'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gnas pa na lus la dmigs te dran pa gnas pa dang / rab tu gnas pa dang / legs par gnas pa dang / zhi ba dang / dul ba dang / nye bar zhi zhing ting nge 'dzin de gcig tu gyur cing gnas so //
analyzed: de'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gnas pa na lus la dmigs te dran pa gnas pa dang / rab tu gnas pa dang / legs par gnas pa dang / zhi ba dang / dul ba dang / nye bar zhi zhing ting nge 'dzin de gcig tu gyur cing gnas so //
translated: and when he dwells contemplating the body as a body, mindfulness is established and present. When mindfulness is established and present, then the body is investigated, well investigated, and well penetrated by way of the body.

original: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la chos rnams kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la chos rnams kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: He dwells contemplating feelings as feelings,🔽and so on up to:

original: de chos rnams la chos rnams kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye @14a * //🔽bar gnas te /
analyzed: de chos rnams la chos rnams kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye @14a * // bar gnas te /
translated: He observes phenomena with regard to phenomena, and mindfulness is present.

original: chos rnams la dmigs nas dran pa gnas pa dang / rab tu gnas pa dang / legs par gnas pa dang / zhi ba dang / dul ba dang / nye bar zhi zhing ting nge 'dzin de gcig tu gyur cing gnas so //
analyzed: chos rnams la dmigs nas dran pa gnas pa dang / rab tu gnas pa dang / legs par gnas pa dang / zhi ba dang / dul ba dang / nye bar zhi zhing ting nge 'dzin de gcig tu gyur cing gnas so //
translated: Observing phenomena, mindfulness is present, well present, well established, calm, disciplined, and well pacified, and that concentration becomes and remains one-pointed.

original: 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu chen po 'di tsam gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la dga' zhing rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu chen po 'di tsam gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa la dga' zhing rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Noble Mahā­maudgalyāyana, this is how one delights in and rejoices in the cultivation of the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas bshad pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang nas 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas bshad pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang nas 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, delighted and rejoicing in the venerable Aniruddha’s explanation, entered into such a samādhi.

original: ji ltar sems ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag na tsher ma gsum pa can gyi tshul nas mi snang bar 'gyur zhing brga ba'i ri bong gsod pa zhes bya ba'i ri dags kyi nags 'jigs skrag na gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la
analyzed: ji ltar sems ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag na tsher ma gsum pa can gyi tshul nas mi snang bar 'gyur zhing brga ba'i ri bong gsod pa zhes bya ba'i ri dags kyi nags 'jigs skrag na gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la
translated: When the mind is in equipoise in samādhi, the three thorns do not appear, and one abides in the forest of deer called the killer of the rabbit of faults.

original: snyoms par zhugs so zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs so zhes gsungs so /
translated: Thus, it is said that one enters into meditative equipoise.

original: // / ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: As it is said, the Blessed One...

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig dgongs ka nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig dgongs ka nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te /
translated: Then, in the evening, a certain monk rose from his seclusion

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: and approached the Blessed One.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Sitting to one side, that monk said to the Blessed One:🔽Blessed One,

original: btsun pa byang chub kyi yan lag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bshad pa /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsun pa byang chub kyi yan lag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bshad pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Venerable, it is said, ‘awakening factors, awakening factors.’

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba 'di gang gi tshig bla dags lags /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba 'di gang gi tshig bla dags lags /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‘awakening factors’?”

original: dge slong byang chub kyi yan lag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bshad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong byang chub kyi yan lag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bshad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: “Monk, it is said, ‘awakening factors, awakening factors.’

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos so bdun gyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos so bdun gyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: The term ‘awakening factors’ refers to the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: dge slong 'on kyang byang chub kyi yan lag rnams go rims bzhin du skye zhing byang chub kyi yan lag rnams go rims bzhin du 'thob ba dang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong 'on kyang byang chub kyi yan lag rnams go rims bzhin du skye zhing byang chub kyi yan lag rnams go rims bzhin du 'thob ba dang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Monk, however, the awakening factors arise in sequence, and the awakening factors are attained and cultivated in sequence, and are completed in sequence.”

original: btsun pa ji lta ji ltar byang chub kyi yan lag rnams go rims bzhin dus skye zhing byang chub kyi yan lag rnams go rims bzhin du 'thob pa dang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: btsun pa ji lta ji ltar byang chub kyi yan lag rnams go rims bzhin dus skye zhing byang chub kyi yan lag rnams go rims bzhin du 'thob pa dang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Venerable, how do the awakening factors arise in sequence, and how are the awakening factors attained and cultivated in sequence, and completed in sequence?”

original: 'di na dge @14b slong lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: 'di na dge @14b slong lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Here, a monk dwells contemplating (the nature of) the body in the body,

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de'i tshe ni dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhing kun du mi rmongs pa yin te /
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de'i tshe ni dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhing kun du mi rmongs pa yin te /
translated: when he dwells contemplating (the nature of) the body in the body, then mindfulness is present in him and he is not confused.

original: de'i tshe na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing /
translated: At that time, the beginning of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness is made.

original: de'i tshe na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom par 'gyur la de'i tshe na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom par 'gyur la de'i tshe na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the cultivation of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness is made. At that time, the cultivation of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness is fulfilled.

original: de bzhin du dran pa dang chos de sems pa dang / rab tu sems pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod par byed cing chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de'i tshe mgo rtsom pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa dang chos de sems pa dang / rab tu sems pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod par byed cing chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de'i tshe mgo rtsom pa yin zhing /
translated: In the same way, when he thinks about the Dharma, reflects on the Dharma, fully understands the Dharma, and discerns the Dharma, the beginning of the enlightenment factor of the investigation of phenomena is made.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de'i tshe bsgom par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de'i tshe bsgom par 'gyur la /
translated: At that time, the limb of enlightenment that is perfect discernment of phenomena is cultivated.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de'i tshe bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de'i tshe bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the cultivation of the limb of enlightenment that is perfect discernment of phenomena is completed.

original: de chos de dag la sems pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod par byed na /
analyzed: de chos de dag la sems pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod par byed na /
translated: When he is reflecting on, investigating, and analyzing those phenomena,

original: de la ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur te /🔽de'i tshe na brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de la ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur te / de'i tshe na brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing /
translated: he will begin to apply diligence without discouragement.🔽At that time, the limb of enlightenment that is perfect effort is begun.

original: de'i tshe brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
translated: At that time, the limb of enlightenment that is perfect effort is cultivated.

original: de'i tshe brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the cultivation of the limb of enlightenment that is perfect effort is completed.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la zang zing med pa'i dga' ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la zang zing med pa'i dga' ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In one who has begun to apply diligence, a disinterested joy arises.

original: de'i tshe dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing /🔽de'i tshe dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing / de'i tshe dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
translated: At that time, the beginning of the cultivation of the factor of perfect joy is initiated.🔽At that time, the cultivation of the factor of perfect joy is cultivated.

original: de'i tshe dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the cultivation of the factor of perfect joy is completed.

original: yid dga' ba la lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur te /🔽de'i tshe na shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing ;
analyzed: yid dga' ba la lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur te / de'i tshe na shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing ;
translated: When the mind is joyful, the body and mind become very pliable.🔽At that time, the beginning of the cultivation of the factor of perfect pliancy is initiated.

original: de'i tshe na shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe na shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
translated: At that time, the cultivation of the factor of perfect pliancy is cultivated.

original: de'i tshe na shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //🔽lus shin tu sbyangs na bde ba myong zhing de'i sems ting nge 'dzin la mnyam @15a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe na shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro // lus shin tu sbyangs na bde ba myong zhing de'i sems ting nge 'dzin la mnyam @15a * //
translated: At that time, the cultivation of the factor of perfect pliancy is completed.

original: par 'jog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: par 'jog par 'gyur te /
translated: When the body is very pliable, one experiences bliss and one’s mind becomes concentrated in meditative equipoise.

original: de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing //🔽de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing // de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
translated: At that time, the enlightenment factor of concentration begins.🔽At that time, one cultivates the enlightenment factor of concentration.

original: de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the cultivation of the enlightenment factor of concentration is completed.

original: de bzhin du mnyam par 'jog pa na 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas btang snyoms su 'gyur te /🔽de'i tshe btang snyoms yang dag byang chub yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing /🔽de'i tshe btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mnyam par 'jog pa na 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas btang snyoms su 'gyur te / de'i tshe btang snyoms yang dag byang chub yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing / de'i tshe btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, when one is in equipoise, having eliminated worldly covetousness and mental dissatisfaction, one becomes equanimous.🔽At that time, the enlightenment factor of equanimity begins.🔽At that time, one cultivates the enlightenment factor of equanimity.

original: de'i tshe btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yong su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yong su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the cultivation of the enlightenment factor of equanimity is completed.

original: 'di na dge slong tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la chos rnams kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la chos rnams kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Here, monks, a monk, regarding feelings, regarding mind, regarding dharmas, dwells watching dharmas.

original: chos rnams la chos rnams kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de'i dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhing kun tu mi rmongs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos rnams kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de'i dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhing kun tu mi rmongs pa yin te /
translated: When he dwells watching dharmas, his mindfulness is present and he is not confused.

original: de'i tshe na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mgo rtsom pa yin zhing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: At that time, the limb of enlightenment of mindfulness begins, and so on up to

original: rgyas par de'i tshe na btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rgyas par de'i tshe na btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: at that time, the cultivation of the limb of enlightenment of equanimity is completed.

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rjes su 'thob par 'gyur zhing go rims 'dis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rjes su 'thob par 'gyur zhing go rims 'dis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so /
translated: Monks, in this way, the limbs of enlightenment are attained, and in this order, the limbs of enlightenment arise.

original: // / dge slong dag ji ltar na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / dge slong dag ji ltar na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Monks, how is it that?

original: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang nub pa dag bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang nub pa dag bshad par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I will teach the origin and disappearance of the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen to it and pay attention, I will speak.”

original: dge slong dag ji ltar na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams kun 'byung ba dang nub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji ltar na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams kun 'byung ba dang nub pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Monks, how is it that the four establishments of mindfulness have their origin and disappearance?

original: dge slong dag zas kun 'byung bas lus kun 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag zas kun 'byung bas lus kun 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Monks, the body has its origin in food.

original: zas 'gags pas lus 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas 'gags pas lus 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When food ceases, the body ceases.

original: lus kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / lus 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / lus kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes @15b su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / mi rten cing gnas na 'jig rten cung zad kyang nye bar mi len to //
analyzed: lus kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / lus 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / lus kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes @15b su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / mi rten cing gnas na 'jig rten cung zad kyang nye bar mi len to //
translated: One who sees the body as having the nature of arising sees the body as it really is. One who sees the body as having the nature of cessation sees the body as it really is. One who sees the body as having the nature of arising and cessation sees the body as it really is. If one does not rely on and abide in the body, one does not take up even the slightest worldly thing.

original: dge slong dag reg par kun 'byung bas tshor ba kun 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag reg par kun 'byung bas tshor ba kun 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Monks, feeling has its origin in contact.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba nub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba nub par 'gyur te /
translated: When contact ceases, feeling subsides.

original: tshor ba kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang ; tshor ba 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / tshor ba kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang /
analyzed: tshor ba kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang ; tshor ba 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / tshor ba kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang /
translated: They abide in the recognition that feeling has the nature of arising, that it has the nature of ceasing, and that it has the nature of both arising and ceasing.

original: mi rten cing gnas na 'jig rten cung zad kyang nye bar mi len to //🔽dge slong dag ming dang gzugs kun 'byung bas sems kun 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: mi rten cing gnas na 'jig rten cung zad kyang nye bar mi len to // dge slong dag ming dang gzugs kun 'byung bas sems kun 'byung ba yin la /
translated: When they abide without support, they do not take up anything in the world.🔽Monks, the arising of mind is due to the arising of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas sems nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas sems nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The subsiding of mind is due to the cessation of name-and-form.

original: sems kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / sems 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / sems kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / mi rten cing gnas na 'jig rten cung zad kyang nye bar mi len to //
analyzed: sems kun 'byung ba'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / sems 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / sems kun 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du rjes su mthong zhing gnas pa dang / mi rten cing gnas na 'jig rten cung zad kyang nye bar mi len to //
translated: and they do not take up anything in the world.

original: dge slong dag yid pa byed pa kun 'byung bas chos kun 'byung ba yin zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag yid pa byed pa kun 'byung bas chos kun 'byung ba yin zhing /
translated: “Monks, phenomena arise due to the arising of mental activity.

original: yid la byed pa 'gags pas chos nub par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dge slong dag skyes bu dam pa dang / skyes bu dam pa las kyang skyes bu dam pa dag bsten par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, a holy being should rely on a holy being.

original: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen to this well and keep it in mind. I will teach it.

original: skyes bu dam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a holy being?

original: slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
analyzed: slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
translated: One who possesses the correct view of a learner, the correct thought of a learner, the correct speech of a learner, the correct action of a learner, the correct livelihood of a learner, the correct effort of a learner, the correct mindfulness of a learner, and the correct concentration of a learner.

original: slob pa'i yang dag ba'i dran pa dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par ldan ba ste 'di ni skyes bu dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i yang dag ba'i dran pa dang / slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par ldan ba ste 'di ni skyes bu dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The person who is endowed with the right mindfulness and right concentration of a learner is called a holy person.

original: skyes bu dam pa las kyang skyes bu dam pa gang zhe na /🔽mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan ba nas /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa las kyang skyes bu dam pa gang zhe na / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan ba nas /
translated: What is the holy person who is superior to the holy person?🔽The person who is endowed with the right view, etc. of a non-learner up to

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar dang ldan pa ste /
translated: the right concentration of a non-learner.

original: 'di ni skyes bu dam pa las kyang skyes bu dam pa zhes bya'o //🔽dge slong dag skyes bu dam pa dang / skyes bu @23a * //
analyzed: 'di ni skyes bu dam pa las kyang skyes bu dam pa zhes bya'o // dge slong dag skyes bu dam pa dang / skyes bu @23a * //
translated: This is called the holy person who is superior to the holy person.

original: dam pa las kyang skyes bu dam pa bsten par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dam pa las kyang skyes bu dam pa bsten par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Monks, I have explained in detail what I taught in brief when I said that you should attend on the holy person and the holy person who is superior to the holy person.

original: 'o na brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then Śakra said,

original: dbyangs dang bcas pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i brgya byin gyis dris pa'i mdo las te /
analyzed: dbyangs dang bcas pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i brgya byin gyis dris pa'i mdo las te /
translated: in the Sūtra of Śakra’s Questions from the three-verse Metrical Recitation with Melody:

original: btsun pa de la bdag 'di snyam du kye ma bdag 'di nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: btsun pa de la bdag 'di snyam du kye ma bdag 'di nas shi 'phos te /
translated: “Lord, I thought, ‘Oh, may I die from here

original: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur zhing gang yang bdag phyug cing nor mngal longs spyod che ba dang / rdzas dang nye bar sbyar ba mang ba dang / rang dbang ba mang ba dang / nor dang 'bru dang gser dang sa le sbram dang bang ba dang mdzod kyi tshogs rab tu mang po dang /
analyzed: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur zhing gang yang bdag phyug cing nor mngal longs spyod che ba dang / rdzas dang nye bar sbyar ba mang ba dang / rang dbang ba mang ba dang / nor dang 'bru dang gser dang sa le sbram dang bang ba dang mdzod kyi tshogs rab tu mang po dang /
translated: and be reborn with the good fortune of humans. May I be wealthy, with great wealth and possessions, with many goods and resources, with much independence, with many riches, grains, gold, silver, and treasuries,

original: bran pho dang bran mo dang las byed pa'i skyes bu mang po dang / grogs po dang mdza' bo dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams rab tu mang po de lta bu'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye zhing /
analyzed: bran pho dang bran mo dang las byed pa'i skyes bu mang po dang / grogs po dang mdza' bo dang nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams rab tu mang po de lta bu'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye zhing /
translated: with many male and female servants and workers, with many friends, loved ones, relatives, and blood relations. May I be reborn in a family with such good fortune.’

original: der yang bdag cher skyes shing dbang po rnams yongs su smin pas sbyin ba dag byin bsod nams dag byas nas skra dang kha spu bregs shing gos ngur smrig bgos nas dad pas yang dag pa kho nar khyim med par rab tu byung ba dang /
analyzed: der yang bdag cher skyes shing dbang po rnams yongs su smin pas sbyin ba dag byin bsod nams dag byas nas skra dang kha spu bregs shing gos ngur smrig bgos nas dad pas yang dag pa kho nar khyim med par rab tu byung ba dang /
translated: There, having grown up, my faculties matured, I gave gifts, made merit, shaved off my hair and beard, put on the orange robes, and with faith went forth from home to homelessness.🔽“ ‘Lord, if I were to live in a proper way and if I were to attain the state of knowing the truth, and if, having attained the state of knowing the truth, I were to end my suffering, then I would live in a proper way.

original: btsun pa bdag rigs par gnas shing gal te kun shes par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / kun shes pa 'byung nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa de ltar bdag rigs bar gnas par gyur cig / gal te kun shes par ma gyur cing bdag tha mar rnam par nyams na lha gzugs can yid las byung ba /🔽dbang po tshang zhing ma nyams pa /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag rigs par gnas shing gal te kun shes par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / kun shes pa 'byung nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed pa de ltar bdag rigs bar gnas par gyur cig / gal te kun shes par ma gyur cing bdag tha mar rnam par nyams na lha gzugs can yid las byung ba / dbang po tshang zhing ma nyams pa /
translated: If I were not to attain the state of knowing the truth and were to fall away in the end, then I would be a god with a mind-made body,🔽with complete and unimpaired faculties,

original: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan ba /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan ba /
translated: with all limbs and digits intact,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs mdzes pa /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs mdzes pa /
translated: with a beautiful color and shape,

original: rang gi 'od can nam mkha' la thogs pa med par 'gro ba /
analyzed: rang gi 'od can nam mkha' la thogs pa med par 'gro ba /
translated: with my own light, moving unimpeded through the sky,

original: dga' ba za zhing dga' ba'i zas can /
analyzed: dga' ba za zhing dga' ba'i zas can /
translated: eating joy, subsisting on joy.

original: tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas pa der skye bar gyur cig / bdag ni rigs nas gal te kun shes 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas pa der skye bar gyur cig / bdag ni rigs nas gal te kun shes 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: If I am born in a good family, may I become omniscient.

original: kun shes 'byung ba de nyid bdag gi sdug bsngal mthar //
analyzed: kun shes 'byung ba de nyid bdag gi sdug bsngal mthar //
translated: And may that omniscience be the end of my suffering.

original: bdag ni rigs gnas gal te kun shes ma gyur cing /
analyzed: bdag ni rigs gnas gal te kun shes ma gyur cing /
translated: If I am born in a good family, but do not become omniscient,

original: bdag ni tha mar nyams na lta gang 'og min zhes //
analyzed: bdag ni tha mar nyams na lta gang 'og min zhes //
translated: and if I fall away in the end, may I be born in the highest heaven,🔽known as Akaniṣṭha.

original: rnam par grags pa der ni skye bar 'gyur bar shog / bcom ldan bdag ni rgyun zhugs bde gshegs rgyun zhugs te //
analyzed: rnam par grags pa der ni skye bar 'gyur bar shog / bcom ldan bdag ni rgyun zhugs bde gshegs rgyun zhugs te //
translated: Blessed One, I am a stream-enterer, a Sugata, a stream-enterer.

original: ma thob par gnas lan cig phyir 'ong bdag 'dod @23b do ;
analyzed: ma thob par gnas lan cig phyir 'ong bdag 'dod @23b do ;
translated: I wish to be a once-returner, but have not attained it.

original: / legs so brgya byin bag yod par ni gnas par gyis //
analyzed: / legs so brgya byin bag yod par ni gnas par gyis //
translated: Excellent, Śakra! Be careful!

original: gang gis rgyun zhugs nges par rang bdag nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: gang gis rgyun zhugs nges par rang bdag nyid kyis ni //
translated: By what means does a stream-enterer, by his very nature,

original: rgyu mtshan gang las khyad par dang po rgya chen rtogs //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang las khyad par dang po rgya chen rtogs //
translated: realize the first special stage?

original: bcom ldan nyid las gzhan min ston pa gzhan min zhes //
analyzed: bcom ldan nyid las gzhan min ston pa gzhan min zhes //
translated: The Blessed One is not different from that, and the Teacher is not different.

original: gzhan dang mi mtshungs khyad par bdag gis mngon par shes //
analyzed: gzhan dang mi mtshungs khyad par bdag gis mngon par shes //
translated: I have a special, uncommon knowledge.

original: drang srong dag ni lhar gyur 'di na 'dug bzhin du //🔽slar yang srog rnyed lta bur blo ldan bdag 'dzin to //
analyzed: drang srong dag ni lhar gyur 'di na 'dug bzhin du // slar yang srog rnyed lta bur blo ldan bdag 'dzin to //
translated: The sages, having become gods, are present here.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The wise one, like one who has regained life, takes up the self.

original: 'gog pa thob pa phyir mi 'ongs //🔽lus kyis mngon du byed par 'dod //
analyzed: 'gog pa thob pa phyir mi 'ongs // lus kyis mngon du byed par 'dod //
translated: The non-returner who has attained cessation

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: is said to manifest with the body.

original: bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gzhi n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gzhi n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the Nyagrodha Park in Kapilavastu.

original: de'i tshe ser skya'i yul mi sh'akya rab tu mang po rnams 'dun ma 'dus shing tshogs nas 'dug bar gyur pa de dag gtam gzhan brjod pa 'di lta bu gleng lags te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ser skya'i yul mi sh'akya rab tu mang po rnams 'dun ma 'dus shing tshogs nas 'dug bar gyur pa de dag gtam gzhan brjod pa 'di lta bu gleng lags te /
translated: At that time, a great many Śākyas of Kapilavastu gathered together and sat down. They were engaged in the following discussion:

original: ming chen da ltar 'di na gang gang gis na da ltar 'di na sh'akya mda' lag 'chi pa'i dus na myos par gyur pa 'thungs shing bslab pa dral ba /
analyzed: ming chen da ltar 'di na gang gang gis na da ltar 'di na sh'akya mda' lag 'chi pa'i dus na myos par gyur pa 'thungs shing bslab pa dral ba /
translated: Mahānāman, now, by whom and for what reason was Śākya Aṅgada, at the time of his death, intoxicated, drank alcohol, and broke the precepts?

original: de bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyun du zhugs pa mi ltung ba'i chos can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges pa tha mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyun du zhugs pa mi ltung ba'i chos can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges pa tha mar 'gyur te /
translated: The Blessed One declared, “He will be a stream-enterer, one who will not return, one who is certain to achieve full awakening.

original: srid pa lan bdun pa lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun nying mtshams sbyar nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //🔽des ming chen khyod bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song nas /
analyzed: srid pa lan bdun pa lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun nying mtshams sbyar nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to // des ming chen khyod bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song nas /
translated: He will be reborn seven times among gods and humans, and then he will make an end to suffering.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la don 'di lta bu yongs su dris la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la don 'di lta bu yongs su dris la /
translated: “Mahānāman, go to the Blessed One and ask him about this matter.🔽Then hold on to what the Blessed One tells you.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar lung bstan pa de bzhin du zung shig / de nas sh'akya ming chen bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste nye bar song nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar lung bstan pa de bzhin du zung shig / de nas sh'akya ming chen bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste nye bar song nas /
translated: Then the Śākya Mahānāman went to the Blessed One. When he arrived,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Seated to one side, Śākya Mahānāman said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bdag cag ser skya'i gzhi'i yul mi sh'akya rab tu mang po rnams 'dun ma 'dus shing tshogs te 'dus par gyur pa de dag gtam gzhan brjod pa 'di lta bu gleng lags te /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag cag ser skya'i gzhi'i yul mi sh'akya rab tu mang po rnams 'dun ma 'dus shing tshogs te 'dus par gyur pa de dag gtam gzhan brjod pa 'di lta bu gleng lags te /
translated: “Venerable One, the people of the Śākya clan in the city of Kapilavastu have gathered together and are discussing the following:

original: ming chen da ltar 'di na gang gang gis tha mar 'gyur te /🔽da lta 'di na sh'akya mda' lag 'chi ba'i dus na myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs shing bslab pa dral ba de yang bcom ldan 'das @24a * //
analyzed: ming chen da ltar 'di na gang gang gis tha mar 'gyur te / da lta 'di na sh'akya mda' lag 'chi ba'i dus na myos par 'gyur ba 'thungs shing bslab pa dral ba de yang bcom ldan 'das @24a * //
translated: ‘Mahānāman, who will be the last one now?

original: kyis rgyun du zhugs pa mi ltung ba'i chos can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par srid pa lan bdun pa /
analyzed: kyis rgyun du zhugs pa mi ltung ba'i chos can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par srid pa lan bdun pa /
translated: Now Śākya Dhanuṣkāra, at the time of his death, drank alcohol and broke his precepts. The Blessed One has prophesied that he will be a stream enterer, one who will not fall into the lower realms, and is certain to attain perfect awakening.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun nyid mtshams sbyar nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun nyid mtshams sbyar nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
translated: He will be reborn seven times among gods and humans, and then will put an end to suffering.

original: btsun pa 'di ji lta bu zhes bcom ldan 'das la bdag dogs pa 'di lta bu yongs su 'dri'o //
analyzed: btsun pa 'di ji lta bu zhes bcom ldan 'das la bdag dogs pa 'di lta bu yongs su 'dri'o //
translated: Venerable, I have this doubt and I ask the Blessed One about it.

original: ming chen 'phags pa nyan thos dag bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: ming chen 'phags pa nyan thos dag bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa ste /
translated: Mahanama, noble disciples say, “The Well-Gone One is a teacher.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa zhes smra ba ni legs par smra ba yin zhing sems bskyed pa dang / drang po'i lta ba can dang / lta ba legs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa zhes smra ba ni legs par smra ba yin zhing sems bskyed pa dang / drang po'i lta ba can dang / lta ba legs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Well-Gone One is a teacher,” and those who say this speak well.

original: ming chen 'phags pa nyan thos dag bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'di legs par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ming chen 'phags pa nyan thos dag bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'di legs par gsungs pa ste /
translated: Mahanama, noble disciples say, “The Blessed One’s Dharma is well-expounded.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ni legs par gsungs pa'i zhes smra ba ni legs par smra ba yin zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ni legs par gsungs pa'i zhes smra ba ni legs par smra ba yin zhing /
translated: The Blessed One’s Dharma is well-expounded,” and those who say this speak well.

original: sems bskyed pa dang / lta ba drang po can dang / lta ba legs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang / lta ba drang po can dang / lta ba legs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They generate the mind of awakening, have an upright view, and have a good view.

original: ming chen 'phags pa nyan thos dag bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: ming chen 'phags pa nyan thos dag bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa ste /
translated: Mahanama, noble disciples say, “The Blessed One’s Saṅgha of disciples is practicing well.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa'o zhes smra ba ni legs par smra ba yin zhing sems bskyed pa dang / lta ba drang po can dang / lta ba legs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa'o zhes smra ba ni legs par smra ba yin zhing sems bskyed pa dang / lta ba drang po can dang / lta ba legs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Blessed One's community of disciples is well-practiced, is well-spoken, and it generates the mind of enlightenment, has upright views, and has good views.

original: ming chen 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos sangs rgyas la dad pa mi phyed pa dang chos dang dge 'dun la dad pa mi phyed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ming chen 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos sangs rgyas la dad pa mi phyed pa dang chos dang dge 'dun la dad pa mi phyed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Mahanama, here, a noble disciple becomes one who has unwavering faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha,

original: shes rab che ba dang / shes rab myur ba dang / shes rab rno ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab dang / skyo ba'i shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i shes rab dang yang dag par ldan ba dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas gnas shing 'di'i shes rab zag par lta ba yongs su zad pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab che ba dang / shes rab myur ba dang / shes rab rno ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab dang / skyo ba'i shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i shes rab dang yang dag par ldan ba dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas gnas shing 'di'i shes rab zag par lta ba yongs su zad pa ste /
translated: and is endowed with great wisdom, swift wisdom, sharp wisdom, wisdom of renunciation, wisdom of disenchantment, and liberating wisdom, and abides having manifested the eight liberations with their bodies, and their wisdom is completely exhausted of views to be abandoned.

original: ming chen 'di ni 'phags ba nyan thos dmyal bar mi 'gro ba yi dags dang dud 'gror mi 'gro ba ngan song ngan 'gro log par mi ltung par mi 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: ming chen 'di ni 'phags ba nyan thos dmyal bar mi 'gro ba yi dags dang dud 'gror mi 'gro ba ngan song ngan 'gro log par mi ltung par mi 'gro ba ste /
translated: Mahanama, this is an arya sravaka who does not go to the hells, does not go to the realm of hungry ghosts, does not go to the animal realm, does not go to the lower realms, does not go to the evil destinies.

original: gang yang 'di skad du gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: He is also called one who is liberated from both aspects.

original: gzhan yang ming chen 'phags pa nyan thos sangs rgyas la dad pa mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba nas rnam par grol ba'i shes rab dang ldan ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ming chen 'phags pa nyan thos sangs rgyas la dad pa mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba nas rnam par grol ba'i shes rab dang ldan ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: Moreover, Mahanama, an arya sravaka who does not have faith in the Buddha, and so on up to one who is endowed with the wisdom of liberation,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad lus kyis @24b mngon sum du byas te gnas shing 'di'i shes rab zag par lta ba yongs su zad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad lus kyis @24b mngon sum du byas te gnas shing 'di'i shes rab zag par lta ba yongs su zad pa ste /
translated: who dwells having manifested the eight liberations in his body, and whose wisdom has exhausted the view of defilement,

original: ming chen 'di ni 'phags pa nyan thos dmyal bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ming chen 'di ni 'phags pa nyan thos dmyal bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Mahanama, this is an arya sravaka who does not go to the hells, and so on up to

original: ngan song ngan 'gro log par mi ltung bzhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ngan song ngan 'gro log par mi ltung bzhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: who does not go to the lower realms, does not go to the evil destinies.

original: gang yang ji skad du shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes brjod pa'o//
analyzed: gang yang ji skad du shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes brjod pa'o//
translated: And also:🔽One is called “liberated by wisdom.”🔽

original: gzhan yang ming chen sangs rgyas la dad pa mi phyed pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang ming chen sangs rgyas la dad pa mi phyed pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is also said, “Mahanama, one who has unshakable faith in the Buddha...

original: rnam par grol ba'i shes rab dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i shes rab dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: ...and is endowed with the wisdom of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad lus kyis mngon sum du byas te gnas shing 'di'i shes rab zag par lta ba yongs su zad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad lus kyis mngon sum du byas te gnas shing 'di'i shes rab zag par lta ba yongs su zad pa ste /
translated: ...having actualized the eight liberations with his body, his wisdom is exhausted of the view of defilement.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /

original: ; lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ; lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the training in higher morality?

original: 'di ni dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan bar gnas shing so sor thar pas bsdams na cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par lta zhing /

translated: This is a monk who, dwelling in morality and restrained by the prātimokṣa, is perfect in his conduct and way of life and sees fear in the slightest transgression.

analyzed: bslab pa yang dag par blangs pa la slob par byed pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /

original: 'di ni dge slong 'dod pa las dben pa zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: 'di ni lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ni dge slong sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing /

analyzed: 'di ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //

original: bslab pa gsum po phun tshogs pa'i //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po phun tshogs pa'i //

original: dge slong gang der spyod par byed //
analyzed: dge slong gang der spyod par byed //

analyzed: phyogs kun zil gyis gnon byed pa //

original: de ni bslob lam yang dag pa'i //
analyzed: de ni bslob lam yang dag pa'i //

analyzed: bya ba byas pa / byed pa byas pa /
translated: his work is done,

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: his burden is laid down,

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: he has attained his own goal,

original: srid pa kun du sbyor ba /
analyzed: srid pa kun du sbyor ba /

analyzed: yongs su zad pa /

original: ji ltar na bram zer 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bram zer 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar na bram zer 'gyur ro //

translated: He becomes distant from the sinful and non-meritorious dharmas which are associated with the defilements, which are connected with disease, and which have a painful evolution, from future birth, old age, disease, and death.

original: 'di ltar na 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar na 'phags par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ji ltar na khrus byed par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos yang srid par kun nas nyon mongs pa can nad dang bcas shing rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba /
translated: This is the purification of the unwholesome, non-virtuous dharmas, which are defiled by the afflictions of rebirth, along with their diseases, and which have the suffering of their ripening.

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba rnams dag par byas pa ste /

analyzed: de ltar na 'o na sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la kha bskang bya dgos so zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang ngas bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: dge sbyong gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de /

original: / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi ste /
translated: It is the four fruits of the religious life.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu'o //
translated: They are the fruit of the first of the religious life, the fruit of the second, the fruit of the third, and the fruit of the fourth.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /

analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no //

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /

analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs shing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug srab mor gyur pa gang yin pa de yin no //

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /

analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pa gang yin ba de yin no //

analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyi mchog dgra bcom pa nyid dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gang zhe na /

translated: I have understood that as long as I have not been separated from the perverted mind and have remained in it many times, I have not attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

translated: “Bhikṣus, when I turned the wheel of the Dharma of the four noble truths three times and in twelve aspects, I generated the eye of the holy Dharma. I generated knowledge, awareness, and understanding. Then I was liberated from the world with its gods,

original: bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i lha dang mi las rnam par grol zhing mi ldan pa dang / rab tu mi ldan pa dang / sems phyin ci log dang bral zhing lan mang du gnas so //

translated: with its Māra and Brahmā, with its renunciants and brahmins, and from the generation of beings with their gods, humans, and antigods. I was liberated through non-apprehension and through non-attachment, and I remained in it many times, separated from the perverted mind.🔽“

translated: The yakṣas who dwell in the sky heard from the yakṣas who dwell in the earth, and the gods of the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods heard, and in an instant, a moment, a second, the sound spread as far as the Brahma world.🔽The gods of the Brahma world spoke the sound and proclaimed:🔽“Friends, in the Ṛṣipatana Deer Park in Vārāṇasī, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One with Skillful Means, the One with Knowledge and Ability, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the Secular World, the Supreme One, the Teacher of Gods and Humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One, has turned the wheel of Dharma that has not been turned by ascetics, brahmins, gods, Māras, Brahmās, or anyone else in the world, which has twelve aspects, three revolutions, and three breakings in.

translated: “Monks, that which is abandoned by the noble wisdom is abandoned.”

original: dge slong dag ji srid du dge ba'i chos rnams la dad pa yod pa de @30b srid du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kun du mi 'byung ngo zhes nga smra'o //

translated: “Monks, as long as there is faith in wholesome states, I say that unwholesome states do not arise.

translated: As long as there is effort, shame, embarrassment, and wisdom, I say that unwholesome states do not arise.

original: shes rab nub par gyur cing 'chal ba'i shes rab kyis sems gtugs pa na sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams skye bar 'gyur ro zhes nga smra'o //

translated: When wisdom declines and the mind is obstructed by faulty wisdom, I say that unwholesome states arise.

original: dge slong dag dang pa la brten nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong bar 'gyur zhing dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag dang pa la brten nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong bar 'gyur zhing dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom par 'gyur te /
translated: Monks, based on faith, unwholesome states are abandoned and wholesome states are cultivated.

analyzed: spangs pa na de nyid 'di'i dge ba'o zhes brjod par bya'o //

original: spongs pa de nyid 'di'i dge ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: spongs pa de nyid 'di'i dge ba zhes brjod par bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dge slong dag gang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin ba de ni spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Monks, whatever is abandoned by the wisdom of the noble ones is truly abandoned.

analyzed: slob pa la bag yod pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: dge slong thams cad la bag yod pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes nga mi smra'o //

analyzed: dge slong ji lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi dge slong bag yod pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes nga smra zhe na /

translated: Why is that?
