analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di dbang po rno zhing rjes su mthun pa'i mal cha dang stan la brten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen nye bar bsten cing bsnyen bkur ba dang / rim gror byed pas ring po mi thogs par zag pa zad cing sems rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: Because this venerable one has sharp faculties, relies on suitable bedding and seats, attends upon and serves spiritual friends, and honors them. He will not take long to exhaust the defilements, to attain liberation of mind,

original: shes rab rnam par grol bas bdag gi skye ba zad do //🔽tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol bas bdag gi skye ba zad do // tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
translated: and to attain liberation by means of wisdom. He will say, 'My births have been exhausted.🔽I have practiced pure conduct.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes mthong ba'i chos nyid la rang nyid kyis mngon par shes pa phun sum tshogs pa mngon sum du byas nas gnas so //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes mthong ba'i chos nyid la rang nyid kyis mngon par shes pa phun sum tshogs pa mngon sum du byas nas gnas so //
translated: In this way, they manifest the perfect superknowledges in the very same life and abide by them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dge slong dag mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs 'dod pa sdug pa dga' ba yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa sdud par byed pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs 'dod pa sdug pa dga' ba yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa sdud par byed pa /
translated: Monks, when they see forms that are objects of eye consciousness, desirable, attractive, pleasing, delightful,

original: dga' bar byed pa de dag mthong nas mngon par mi dga' zhing mngon par mi brjod la mi zhen cing lhag par mi zhen cing gnas te /
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa de dag mthong nas mngon par mi dga' zhing mngon par mi brjod la mi zhen cing lhag par mi zhen cing gnas te /
translated: they do not delight in them, do not express delight in them, do not become attached to them, and do not become fixated on them.

original: de de la mi dga' mngon par mi dga' zhing mngon par mi brjod la mi zhen cing lhag par mi zhen cing gnas pa na ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur zhing lus las su rung zhing shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ma rmongs pa'i dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhing sems mnyam par gzhag pa rtse gcig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de de la mi dga' mngon par mi dga' zhing mngon par mi brjod la mi zhen cing lhag par mi zhen cing gnas pa na ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur zhing lus las su rung zhing shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ma rmongs pa'i dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhing sems mnyam par gzhag pa rtse gcig par 'gyur la /
translated: When he is not unhappy, not unhappy, not expressing himself, not attached, not excessively attached, and remains, he undertakes diligence without discouragement, his body becomes serviceable and pliable, and undeluded mindfulness is present, and his mind becomes one-pointedly concentrated.

original: dag pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i tshad med pa legs par bsgom pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dag pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i tshad med pa legs par bsgom pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: He cultivates and expands the immeasurable that is associated with purity.

original: 'di ltar na 'dis ting nge 'dzin dang po mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la spangs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar na 'dis ting nge 'dzin dang po mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la spangs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, he attains abandonment in the first meditative concentration, which is the form that is to be cognized by the eye.

original: dge slong dag rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos 'dod pa sdug pa dga' ba yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa sdud par byed pa dga' bar byed pa de dag @31b rnam par shes nas mngon par mi
analyzed: dge slong dag rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos 'dod pa sdug pa dga' ba yid du 'ong ba 'dod pa sdud par byed pa dga' bar byed pa de dag @31b rnam par shes nas mngon par mi
translated: Monks, when you cognize phenomena that are to be cognized by the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, which are desirable, attractive, delightful, endearing, captivating, enticing, and arousing,

original: dga' zhing mngon par mi brjod la mi zhen cing lhag par mi zhen cing gnas te /
analyzed: dga' zhing mngon par mi brjod la mi zhen cing lhag par mi zhen cing gnas te /
translated: you should not delight in them, express delight in them, be attached to them, or be fixated on them.

original: de de la mngon par mi dga' zhing mngon par mi brjod la mi zhen cing lhag par mi zhen par gnas pa na ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur zhing lus las su rung zhing shin tu sbyangs pa dang ; ma rmongs pa'i dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhang sems mnyam par gzhag pa rtse gcig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de de la mngon par mi dga' zhing mngon par mi brjod la mi zhen cing lhag par mi zhen par gnas pa na ma zhum pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur zhing lus las su rung zhing shin tu sbyangs pa dang ; ma rmongs pa'i dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhang sems mnyam par gzhag pa rtse gcig par 'gyur la /
translated: When you do not delight in them, express delight in them, be attached to them, or be fixated on them, you will apply undaunted diligence, your body will be fit and pliant, your undeluded mindfulness will be present, and your mind will be in equipoise and one-pointed.

original: dga' ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i tshad med pa legs par bsgom pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa'i tshad med pa legs par bsgom pa rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: You will cultivate and expand the immeasurable states that are accompanied by joy.

original: de ltar 'dis ting nge 'dzin drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la spangs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ting nge 'dzin drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la spangs pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, he attains abandonment with respect to the mental objects of the sixth meditative concentration.

original: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ānanda, I say that even for an arhat, gain and honor are an obstacle.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bos te ;
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bos te ;
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o //
translated: Ānanda, I say that even for an arhat, gain and honor are an obstacle.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du 'di skad gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du 'di skad gsungs /
translated: Blessed One, why do you say this?

original: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o //
translated: Ānanda, I say that even for an arhat, gain and honor are an obstacle.

original: ma thob pa thob pa dang ; ma rtogs pa rtogs pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma thob pa thob pa dang ; ma rtogs pa rtogs pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba la ni ma yin te /
translated: Not for attaining what has not been attained, realizing what has not been realized, or manifesting what has not been manifested.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa lhag pa'i sems las byung ba bzhi po gang yang rung ba zhig rtogs pa las yongs su nyams par nga smra'o //🔽gang yang 'dis gcig pu dben par bdag nyid la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi gnas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa lhag pa'i sems las byung ba bzhi po gang yang rung ba zhig rtogs pa las yongs su nyams par nga smra'o // gang yang 'dis gcig pu dben par bdag nyid la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi gnas te /
translated: But I do say that one falls away from the realization of any one of the four higher meditative states that are a pleasant abiding in this visible world.🔽And I also say that one falls away from the physical realization of the unshakable liberation of mind, which is a state of heedfulness, of striving, of solitude, and of benefiting oneself.

original: sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa gang yin pa de las ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba nga mi smra'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa gang yin pa de las ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba nga mi smra'o //
translated: But I do not say that one falls away from that liberation in any way whatsoever.

original: kun dga' bo de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: Ānanda, therefore you should train in this way:

original: gang rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti byung ba dag la sems yongs su gtugs te mi gnas pa de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti byung ba dag la sems yongs su gtugs te mi gnas pa de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “I will not abide with a mind that is overwhelmed by the acquisition of gain and honor, or by the prospect of acquiring gain and honor.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽bcom @32a * //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / bcom @32a * //
translated: Then, the venerable Saṅgharakṣita...

original: ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi ri bo cha can gyi ngos shing 'dab ma bdun pa can gyi phug na bzhugs so //
analyzed: ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi ri bo cha can gyi ngos shing 'dab ma bdun pa can gyi phug na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha, on the slope of Pāṇḍava Mountain, in the cave of Saptāparṇikā.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can rgyal po'i khab kyi drang srong gi ri'i ngos rdo nag po can gyi ri la brten cing gnas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can rgyal po'i khab kyi drang srong gi ri'i ngos rdo nag po can gyi ri la brten cing gnas so //
translated: At that time, the venerable Saṅgharakṣita was staying on the slope of Ṛṣimohana Mountain in Rājagṛha, on Black Rock Mountain.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can gcig pu dben pas bdag la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis gnas pa na dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can gcig pu dben pas bdag la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis gnas pa na dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Then, the venerable Saṅgharakṣita, dwelling alone in seclusion, heedful, ardent, and resolute for his own benefit, by the destruction of the pollutants, in this very life entered and remained in the pollution-free, purified, stainless, undefiled liberation of mind and wisdom.

original: de de las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: de de las yongs su nyams te /
translated: He fell away from that.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang lan drug tu dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang lan drug tu dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
translated: For a second, third, fourth, fifth, and sixth time, by the destruction of the pollutants, in this very life he entered and remained in the pollution-free, purified, stainless, undefiled liberation of mind and wisdom.

original: de de las yongs su nyams so //
analyzed: de de las yongs su nyams so //
translated: He fell away from that.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can 'di snyam du bdag gcig pu dben pas bdag nyid la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis gnas pa na dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can 'di snyam du bdag gcig pu dben pas bdag nyid la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis gnas pa na dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Then the Venerable Ghoṣila thought: “When I was alone, secluded, heedful, ardent, and resolute, I attained the pleasing liberation of mind that is in tune with circumstances.

original: bdag de las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: bdag de las yongs su nyams te /
translated: But I have fallen away from that.

original: lan gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang drug tu dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: lan gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang drug tu dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
translated: I have attained the pleasing liberation of mind that is in tune with circumstances two, three, four, five, and six times.

original: de las kyang bdag yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: de las kyang bdag yongs su nyams te /
translated: But I have fallen away from that.

original: gang bdag gis lan bdun pa la dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa las yongs su nyams par ma gyur cig ces mtshon cha dag 'chang bar byed do //
analyzed: gang bdag gis lan bdun pa la dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa las yongs su nyams par ma gyur cig ces mtshon cha dag 'chang bar byed do //
translated: I will now take up a weapon and say: ‘I will not fall away from the pleasing liberation of mind that is in tune with circumstances for a seventh time.’ ”

original: de nas bdud sdig can 'di snyam du dge sbyong goo ta ma ni rgyal po'i khab kyi ri bo cha can gyi ngos shing 'dab ma bdun pa can gyi phugs na gnas la /
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can 'di snyam du dge sbyong goo ta ma ni rgyal po'i khab kyi ri bo cha can gyi ngos shing 'dab ma bdun pa can gyi phugs na gnas la /
translated: Then the evil Māra thought, “The ascetic Gautama is staying in the hollow of a seven-leaf tree on the side of Vulture Peak Mountain near Rājagṛha.

original: de'i nyan thos dge slong gnag tshogs can rgyal po'i khab kyi drang srong gi ri'i ngos rdo nag po can gyi ri la brten cing gnas so //
analyzed: de'i nyan thos dge slong gnag tshogs can rgyal po'i khab kyi drang srong gi ri'i ngos rdo nag po can gyi ri la brten cing gnas so //
translated: His disciple, the monk Saṅgharakṣita, is staying on Black Rock Mountain on the side of Sage Mountain near Rājagṛha.

original: de gcig pu dben pas bdag nyid la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis gnas pa na dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: de gcig pu dben pas bdag nyid la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis gnas pa na dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
translated: When he was staying alone in solitude, he was heedful and diligent for his own benefit, and in time he attained the pleasant liberation of mind through his physical body.

original: de las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: de las yongs su nyams te /
translated: But he fell away from that.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang drug tu dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang drug tu dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
translated: For a second, third, fourth, fifth, and sixth time, he attained the pleasant liberation of mind through his physical body in time.

original: de de las kyang yongs su nyams pa dang / de @32b 'di snyam du bdag gcig bu dben pas bdag nyid la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis gnas ba na dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: de de las kyang yongs su nyams pa dang / de @32b 'di snyam du bdag gcig bu dben pas bdag nyid la phan pa'i bag yod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis gnas ba na dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas so //
translated: He thinks, “When I was alone, I was heedful, diligent, and lived happily for my own benefit. In time, I manifested the pleasant liberation of mind with the body.

original: bdag de las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: bdag de las yongs su nyams te /
translated: I fell away from that.

original: lan gnyis dang lan gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang drug tu dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: lan gnyis dang lan gsum dang bzhi dang lnga dang drug tu dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /
translated: I manifested the pleasant liberation of mind with the body two, three, four, five, and six times in time.

original: de las kyang bdag yongs su nyams te gang bdag gis lan bdun pa la dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa las yongs su nyams par ma gyur cig ces mtshon cha dag 'chang bar byed do //
analyzed: de las kyang bdag yongs su nyams te gang bdag gis lan bdun pa la dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa las yongs su nyams par ma gyur cig ces mtshon cha dag 'chang bar byed do //
translated: I fell away from that. I will not fall away from the seventh manifestation of the pleasant liberation of mind with the body in time.” He takes up weapons.

original: dge slong gnag tshogs can de mtshon cha 'chang zhing dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas te nga'i yul las 'da' bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas yin zhing go skabs yod do //
analyzed: dge slong gnag tshogs can de mtshon cha 'chang zhing dus kyis sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas te nga'i yul las 'da' bar 'gyur ba 'di ni gnas yin zhing go skabs yod do //
translated: It is possible that the monk Kaulita, who is a member of the dark faction, will take up arms and, by means of time, manifest the pleasant liberation of mind with his body and transcend my domain.

original: gang yang bdag song ste ston ba la smra bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: gang yang bdag song ste ston ba la smra bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I will go and speak to the Teacher.”

analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can bee d'urya'i dbyug pa can gyi rgyud mangs zhig mchan khung du thogs nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'dug ste /
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'dug ste /

analyzed: bee d'urya'i dbyug pa can gyi rgyud mangs brdungs shing tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
translated: and, playing the beryl lute with a strap of beryl, he spoke this verse:

original: dba' chen shes rab chen po pa //
analyzed: dba' chen shes rab chen po pa //
translated: “Great hero, great wisdom,

original: mthu chen dbang dang gzi brjid 'bar //
analyzed: mthu chen dbang dang gzi brjid 'bar //
translated: great power, blazing with authority and splendor,

original: khon dang 'jigs pa kun las 'das //
analyzed: khon dang 'jigs pa kun las 'das //
translated: beyond all enmity and fear,

original: spyan ldan khyod la bdag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: spyan ldan khyod la bdag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to you, O one with eyes.

original: dpa' chen 'chi ba zil gnon pa //
analyzed: dpa' chen 'chi ba zil gnon pa //
translated: The great hero who conquers death.

original: nyan thos 'chi bar 'dod pa dag / thub pa chen pos mkhyen nas ni//
analyzed: nyan thos 'chi bar 'dod pa dag / thub pa chen pos mkhyen nas ni//
translated: The great sage knows that the śrāvakas

original: de dag bzlog par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: de dag bzlog par mdzad du gsol //
translated: wish to die, and he prevents them.🔽Blessed One, when will the śrāvakas

original: bcom ldan nam zhig nyan thos dag / bstan la rab tu dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bcom ldan nam zhig nyan thos dag / bstan la rab tu dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: rejoice in the teaching?

original: slob pa thob par gyur pa na //
analyzed: slob pa thob par gyur pa na //
translated: When they attain the state of training,

original: mi mchog dus ni byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi mchog dus ni byed par 'gyur //
translated: the supreme human will act in time.

analyzed: bdud kyis de ltar smras pa dang // ston pas ma grol bdud las gsungs //
translated: When Māra said this, the Teacher said to the unliberated Māra:

original: bag med ldan pa'i sdig can khyod //
analyzed: bag med ldan pa'i sdig can khyod //
translated: “You, the careless one, the evil one,

original: rang gi don phyir 'ongs pa ste //
analyzed: rang gi don phyir 'ongs pa ste //
translated: have come for your own sake.

original: brtan zhing brtan pa phun tshogs shing //
analyzed: brtan zhing brtan pa phun tshogs shing //

original: bsam gtan sgom par byed pa la //
analyzed: bsam gtan sgom par byed pa la //

analyzed: nyin mtshan rtag tu rjes sbyor ba //

analyzed: 'tsho ba dag la ltos pa med //

analyzed: srid pa 'jigs bcas shes nas ni //

analyzed: srid pa zad par 'gro bar 'gyur//

translated: Monks, noble disciples who are learned see all phenomena as having the nature of suffering, as having an origin, as disappearing, as having a taste, as having an affliction, and as having a separation. They see desire as a heap of burning coals.

original: 'dod pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba dang / 'dod pa rnams mthong ba na 'dod pa rnams la 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa la zhen pa dang / 'dod pa la dga' ba dang / 'dod bar bying ba dang / 'dod par nges pa dang /

translated: When they see desire in this way, they do not long for desire, are not attached to desire, do not delight in desire, do not sink into desire, are not intent on desire,

original: 'dod pa la zhen pa dang / de la sems yongs su gtugs shing mi gnas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la zhen pa dang / de la sems yongs su gtugs shing mi gnas te /

analyzed: 'di de ltar rgyu spyod pa dang gnas pa la mkhas shing rab tu mkhas par gyur na ji ltar na spyod pa dang gnas pa na 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las sems zag pa dang bral bar
translated: When he is thus skilled and well-trained in the causes of conduct and remaining in a state, how does he become free from the defilements of the world, from evil and unwholesome states, such as covetousness and unhappiness, when he is conducting himself and remaining in a state?

original: 'gyur ro // dge slong dag ji ltar na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas thams cad sdug bsngal ba'i chos can dang / kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // dge slong dag ji ltar na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas thams cad sdug bsngal ba'i chos can dang / kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Monks, how does a noble disciple who possesses learning see all things that have the nature of suffering, their origin, their disappearance, the enjoyment, the disadvantages, and the escape, as they really are with right wisdom?

original: dge slong dag 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing 'di ni kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing 'di ni kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: “Monks, here the noble disciple who has learning understands as it truly is: ‘This is the noble truth of suffering.’ He understands as it truly is: ‘This is the origin of suffering,’ ‘This is the cessation of suffering,’ and ‘This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas thams cad sdug bsngal ba'i chos can dang / kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par @34b 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas thams cad sdug bsngal ba'i chos can dang / kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par @34b 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, in this way the noble disciple who has learning sees as it truly is with correct wisdom: ‘All is suffering,’ ‘All is origination,’ ‘All is cessation,’ ‘All is the path.’

original: dge slong dag ji ltar na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'dod pa rnams la sol ba'i phung po lta bur mthong bar 'gyur zhing 'dis 'dod pa rnams de ltar mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin shes shing 'dod pa rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba dang /

translated: How do they not have a desire for desire, not be attached to desire, not delight in desire, not be submerged in desire, not be certain about desire, not be fixated on desire, and not have their minds fully engaged and not rest in desire?
